jobs.title: Director of Product Management
jobs.description:
What we’re building and why we’re building it. 

Fetch is a build-first technology company creating a rewards program to power the world. Over the last 5 years we’ve grown from 0 to 7M active users and taken over the rewards game in the US with our free app. The foundation has been laid. In the next 5 years we will become a global platform that completely transforms how people connect with brands. 

It all comes down to two core beliefs. First, that people deserve to be rewarded when they create value. If a third party directly benefits from an action you take or data you provide, you should be rewarded for it. And not just the “you get to use our product!” cop-out. We’re talkin’ real, explicit value. Fetch points, perhaps. 

Second, we also believe brands need a better and more direct connection with what matters most to them: their customers. -- Brands need to understand what people are doing, and have a direct line to be able to do something about it. Not just advertise, but ACT. Sounds nice right? 

That’s why we’re building the world’s rewards platform. A closed-loop, standardized rewards layer across all consumer behavior that will lead to happier shoppers and stronger brands.

Fetch Rewards is an equal employment opportunity employer.

 

The Role!

At Fetch Rewards, our vision is to help make shopping and everyday activities easy, fun and rewarding. Our millions of users turn their Fetch points into gift cards, charitable donations, or to simply treat themselves! We are ranked as one of the top shopping apps in the App Store, have earned a 4.8/5 rating, and plan to become the premier app for “rewarding life”. 

We are looking for creative, self-driven Directors of Product Management to set the vision, strategy, and deliver success for our product. You will lead cross-functional product and engineering Packs to understand key pain points and opportunities, and then deliver innovative solutions to drive  customer and business outcomes. (This role can be based from one of our offices in Madison, Chicago, Boston, Birmingham, New York and San Francisco -- or be remote from anywhere in the United States.)

  • Experience or desire to build and lead times while also performing as an individual contributor
  • A track record of launching new products and experiences on-time with high quality, measuring results, and achieving positive outcomes
  • Have the product instincts to understand what our customers REALLY want (not just what they tell us) and deliver novel solutions to exceed their expectations 
  • Hypothesis and data-driven to inform priorities and decision making
  • An effective communicator and collaborator including with engineering, UX, analytics, and operational departments.

  • Collaborate with UX/Design, engineering, QA, and data teams to lead the definition, execution, launch, and assessment of innovative product enhancements
  • Collaborate with your peers to elevate the abilities of our product, team, and the overall company
  • Consistently demonstrate clear improvements to user, partner, and business metrics

jobs.title: Product Manager, Decentralized Protocols
jobs.description:
Web3 is the next generation of the internet that aims to create a fairer and more decentralized web. Protocol Labs aims to be at the forefront of this generational shift by researching, building, and productizing protocols to drive breakthroughs in computing and push humanity forward. 
 
We are actively hiring Product Managers who can help us roadmap future directions and achieve product-market fit for our protocols, including IPLD, libp2p, IPFS, Filecoin, as well as new protocols and systems over time. The success of these protocols depends on their ability to attract developers from all industries, all over the world, to build world-class tooling and applications that appeal to global audiences.
 
The Product Manager, Decentralized Protocols (Protocol PM, for short) works closely with our team of world-class distributed systems and protocol engineers to synthesize and prioritize the needs of our stakeholders, create actionable product roadmaps, design and build technical systems with tech leads and engineering teams, and set longer term protocol and product strategy. Protocol PMs deeply empathize with developers as users, with a level of creativity to meet their needs that goes beyond current engineering paradigms. They are able to develop a broad and deep understanding of our protocols that enables them to reason about the wide-ranging and long-term implications of lower-level technical design decisions. They are able to effectively generate buy-in with users, tech leads, and other stakeholders. Protocol PMs are naturally collaborative and are excellent communicators. They help set the culture and direction for large protocol engineering teams. Their work is instrumental to ensuring that our web3 protocols become the foundation of the internet going forward.



As a Product Manager for Decentralized Protocols, you will…
  • Develop a deep understanding of user needs, and translate these needs into actionable product requirements for protocol engineering and protocol research teams
  • Be the voice of our current and future users in technical discussions, understanding the implications of various technical tradeoffs, and ultimately helping to make decisions that will deliver a stellar user experience and achieve our long-term protocol/product goals
  • Work closely with technical leads to design systems that set our protocols on an excellent trajectory for future adoption and success
  • Create actionable roadmaps for engineering teams that span across the creation of new protocols, improvement of existing protocols, building developer-oriented products and APIs, and creating excellent documentation
  • Work closely with engineering managers and technical leads to manage the team responsible for executing on these roadmaps
  • Coordinate with protocol researchers, developer tooling projects, application developers, and other builders across the ecosystem to develop core protocol upgrades and other parts of the product roadmap
  • Collaborate seamlessly and cross-functionally with users, engineering, documentation, other product teams, and product marketing teams
  • Clearly and effectively communicate roadmaps and progress to the rest of Protocol Labs and the broader web3 ecosystem



You may be a fit for this role if you...
  • Have experience managing technical software products from conception to launch, especially for those using nascent technology
  • Have built complex systems and/or highly technical products at scale, either as an engineer or a product manager
  • Have computer science or software engineering experience that you have drawn upon in future leadership roles, especially as a technical lead, product owner, technical product manager, or founder
  • Have experience successfully building developer products, often being the voice of the user through interviews, user stories, technical requirements, and user testing
  • Enjoy collaborating closely with engineers, as well as broader cross-functional teams
  • Are hyper detail-oriented, extremely organized, and pride yourself on your ability to structure large, ambiguous systems into actionable, tractable pieces
  • Have strong written and verbal communication skills with a talent for precise articulations of customer problems
  • Thrive in fast-moving work environments, do whatever it takes to make your team successful, and are not afraid to roll up your sleeves to get the job done



Bonus points…
  • Have product management experience within crypto projects, networks, or low-level systems
  • Have experience as a startup founder for software or technical companies
  • Made contributions to open-source software projects
  • Are self-taught in some field, and consider yourself a voracious learner
  • Have a mix of technical and business background / education (e.g., CS undergrad and MBA, engineering and product management experience, etc.)
What’s it like to work at Protocol Labs?
Protocol Labs mission is to improve humanity’s most important technology, the Internet. We build protocols, systems, and tools to improve how it works. Today, we are focused on how we store, locate, and move information. Our projects include IPFS, Filecoin, libp2p, and more.
 
As a distributed team, we hire anywhere in the world, and at various levels of experience (entry, senior, staff). We look for people with unique perspectives and diverse backgrounds.
 
We have a great benefits package, including parental leave, contributions to your retirement, competitive pay, and unlimited time off. For U.S.-based employees, we also provide platinum-level health, dental, and vision coverage for you and your family.

jobs.title: Senior Product & Retail Operations Manager
jobs.description:
Senior Product & Retail Operations Manager

 

How to Cake it

About Us

At How To Cake It, we provide our community of over 13+ million baking and sweets enthusiasts with everything they need to become better bakers. From leading educational resources such as online tutorials, interactive video courses and live workshops taught by world-class experts, to consumer goods such as cookbooks, baking tools, cookie decorating supplies, kitchenware, and other useful sweet-related merchandise that helps make baking more fun and memorable.

We have a passionate team of people working remotely around the world and at our production studio/headquarters in Toronto.

About the Role

How To Cake It now has a growing product portfolio that includes consumer goods - from sprinkles to spatulas - that we currently sell exclusively on our ecommerce store and ship around the world from our third-party logistics in Florida and our in-house fulfillment centre in Toronto. We also have two new branded Amazon Stores (US and Canada) where we sell a limited number of our products that are fulfilled by FBA (fulfillment by Amazon).

With the goal to rapidly expand the physical product and retail side of the business, we need to build a strong operations team and processes to effectively and profitably service the new platforms and sales channels we have identified as part of our sales expansion strategy, including online, livestream shopping, retailTV (HSN/QVC) and traditional retail/brick-and-mortar initiatives.

The Senior Product & Retail Operations Manager is central to how the consumer goods department operates and will be responsible for the management and expansion of our physical product line and sales channels. The manager will be responsible for integrating and improving operational systems (related to the consumer goods side of our business), optimizing margins and resources, creating and tracking the measurements needed to get the right outcomes, and managing all logistics related to distributing physical products to our B2B and B2C customers (wholesale, retail and direct-to-consumer).

While this role is part of the Consumer Goods department, you will work closely with our Third-party Logistics, Marketing, Content, Design, Customer Service and Business Operations teams to create a 360-degree view of the execution and needs for each new initiative.

Duties and Responsibilities

 

Cross-Functional Communications

  • Drive effective and efficient teamwork, communication and commitment across cross-functional teams with competing priorities
  • Facilitate the process for each team to share regular updates
  • Communicate timely product and sales channel status updates, issues and risks in a concise, accurate and data-driven manner across internal teams and to executives
  • Maintain transparent communication of all product development activities, including product and packaging design, sales and inventory analytics, product margins and pricing, etc.
  • Maintain transparent communication of all sales channel expansion and product fulfillment/delivery activities, including fulfillment, inventory, distribution, etc.
  • Facilitate quarterly product & business review presentations to standardize select areas and share the key messages on performance, execution and planning by project/initiative

Planning

  • Drive the department’s quarterly and annual planning processes, from format and execution through follow-up
  • Collaborate on department and organization-wide goals, including KPIs and resourcing, to ensure we’re driving toward results and set up for success

Process Improvement

  • Implement both critical and routine product development and sales channel expansion/fulfillment process improvements and their measures of success by partnering with our Fulfillment teams (third party logistics & in-house), Business Operations, Customer Service, Marketing and Content teams and Contractors
  • Develop, manage and continue to optimize the processes and communication specific to new B2B clients (wholesale/retail) and new sales channels (ie. Amazon, Range Me, Liveshopping)
  • Optimize the product release process to collect, quantify, curate and communicate actionable product enhancement feedback from internal and external stakeholders and our customers/community
  • Define a product sunset process, with cross-functional collaboration and appropriate decision-making oversight
  • Maintain an eye towards continuous expansion and improvement of products, acknowledging that each product is unique
  • Manage and develop an ongoing department budget and maintenance program for the department’s tools and resources, ensuring best practices of use

Program Management

  • Partner with product, engineering, design, marketing, analytics, operations, integrations, finance, sales and partner success to launch new products and features
  • Manage sales channel expansion plan including but not limited to: wholesales, traditional retail, retail TV accounts, specialty stores etc.
  • Grow existing sales platforms, ensuring proper distribution of inventory
  • Track progress across teams in delivering on the goals
  • Manage third party logistics teams and in-house fulfillments, ensuring profitability, efficiency and delivery of the best customer experience
  • Plan and lead program meetings, driving the execution of complex projects, creating and maintaining schedules and status updates
  • Partner with Engineering team on all resource capacity and alignment needs
  • Anticipate program roadblocks and bottlenecks, as well as adapt quickly to schedule shifts and resource constraints
  • Own the development and maintenance of product documentation to ensure continuous alignment across team members and between departments
  • Oversee staff/contractors for live events, pop up shops and brick and mortar retail stores

Working at How to Cake it

This is a remote, full-time permanent position. We value and invest in professional development, and as a high-growth company, offer significant opportunities to learn new skills, participate in new business initiatives, and grow your influence and role in the company over time.

We’re focused, driven, and passionate about our work – if you live and feel the same way, you’ll fit right in.

There is tremendous opportunity for growth and success here, as we continue to expand, and we can’t wait for you to be a part of it.

 

Requirements

What We’re Looking For

  • Exceptional communication skills -- you cultivate an environment where team members respect each other and work together to deliver high quality products
  • 7+ years of project or program management in the consumer goods industry
  • Experience on the operations/distribution side of an ecommerce, retail or consumer goods organization
  • Process obsessed with a bias toward action
  • Strong budgeting/forecasting, product pricing and inventory management experience and skills
  • A focus on how well an organization scales and how efficiently each team member and contractor operates to achieve the desired customer and business results
  • Experienced in partnering with and bringing multiple departments and stakeholders into alignment
  • Proven track record of leading operations and product teams, and servicing new sales channels including traditional retail and online platforms (ex. Amazon, Range Me)
  • Solid understanding and experience with ecommerce fulfillment processes and platforms including Amazon, Shiphero, Rangeme and liveshopping (optional)
  • Solid understanding and experience with supply chain and distribution of consumer goods and systems (EDI, VPM, etc.)
  • Bonus- experience and understanding of distribution related to RetailTV (HSN/QVC)

How to Cake it strives to build diverse teams that reflect the communities we work in, and encourages applications from traditionally underrepresented groups including women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, people identifying as LGBTQ+, veterans, and people with disabilities.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
About Stellar Health:

Healthcare costs are one of the biggest problems in the United States today. Simultaneously, primary care providers struggle to make ends meet. At Stellar Health, we are building a platform that helps Healthcare Providers (doctors and support staff) improve the quality of care they provide while also reducing their costs and improving their office revenue. In the end, these improvements make patients healthier while improving the efficiency of the entire healthcare ecosystem.

Stellar Health’s product is actively used by hundreds of Medical Groups - and we have proven that it makes a real difference for these practices and their patients. As word of our impact spreads, our book of business is growing, and the number of end users is growing even more rapidly.

It’s an exciting time to join the business: we have a proven product and operating model and are well funded. Our founding team covers a wide range of experience and skills - having built multiple best-in-class technology products in their careers, with deep healthcare knowledge and experience in starting successful companies from the ground up (more about the company at https://stellar.health). Moreover, Value-Based Care is one of the fastest growing and most exciting developments in how healthcare gets delivered in decades – you can help providers, patients and society while applying your product management expertise.

About the position:

Stellar Health is looking for Senior Product Managers join us! You will have the opportunity to own a piece of the product footprint, shape our Product Management culture, work directly with the senior leadership team, and partner with a world class engineering team.  Best of all, you will have the opportunity to work directly with end users to impact patient care for an unlimited number of patients.

Who will love this job:

  • You are obsessive about getting to know our users, understanding their needs and wants, and anticipating opportunities users haven’t yet imagined.
  • You get things done and you love working in a dynamic environment; we move quickly, and it creates opportunities to learn about a wide array of topics.
  • You understand, appreciate, and enjoy the responsibility and accountability that comes with being assigned high level ownership over projects and their success.
  • You work well with cross-functional teams and are a stellar communicator. You thrive off of being able to explain complicated concepts to teammates that are part of different disciplines.
  • You are known for your organizational skills and ability to quickly come up to speed on new domains.
  • You are passionate about building solutions, not just tools, and lean into delighting hard-to-please users.

What you’ll do:

  • Own articulating hypothesis, creating user experience stories, and be accountable for delivering these products on time.
  • Write clear and concise Product Documents for the entire team to align around.
  • Provide effective and constructive feedback by reviewing others’ work.
  • Deliver new features by collaborating regularly with our Operations, Engineering, and leadership team.
  • Hold the engineering team to a high standard of speed and quality.
  • Develop, socialize, and maintain product roadmaps, specifications, and priorities.
  • Establish processes that will improve Stellar Health’s product development practices.
  • Gather data insights and build models for product improvements or for internal use.

You should have:

  • At least 3 years of professional work experience in SaaS or web-based application product management is required.
  • A proven track record of using data to solve business problems.
  • Previous experience working on a product with end users is required.
  • Experience in working on products that support healthcare delivery is an advantage.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially in the form of translating technical concepts to business stakeholders.

Pay, Perks & Such:

We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, stock options, medical, dental, vision, life and disability coverages, a 401k program and flexible vacation. 

Note on COVID response: 

At this time, Stellar is offering a hybrid work environment for those employees who wish to go into our office. We will not be requiring employees to work from our office until 2022. If you would like to learn more about our COVID response measures and Return to Office plans, please mention this when you speak with a Stellar Recruiter. 

Diversity is the key to our success. Stellar Health is an equal opportunity employer and we are open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.  

We believe that diverse teams -and the different identities, cultures, and life experiences our team members bring to the table- enable us to create amazing products, find creative solutions to interesting problems, and build an inclusive working environment. 

We encourage everyone to apply to our roles, even if they do not meet every single qualification on a job description, and our team is committed to reviewing every resume submitted.

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
jobs.description:
Who We're Looking For

Gig Wage is looking for a Product Manager to join our very agile development team. We have a suite of payments and banking web and API products that need refinement and redesign in preparation for scale. This role comes with the opportunity to help define and structure the design and iteration process for a strong, outcome-driven, cross-functional team. You will work closely with the CPO to subdivide ownership of product discovery, design, development, and release. As an early hire, you’ll have a hand in largely defining the product process at Gig Wage as we work toward a continuous-delivery agile development state. If you have a strong conviction about a particular tool, process, methodology, or philosophy, we want to hear about it.

What You'll Do

  • Serve the various teams across the organization to bring a deep understanding of the user voice and needs into the business solutions we build, sell, and service
  • Gain deep and detailed functional expertise of our core payments product
  • Work closely with the CPO and Director of Engineering to manage prioritization and trade-offs among user experience, performance, and operational support load
  • Identify and plan for dependencies in the backlog
  • Develop detailed, crisp business requirements and user stories that can be used to create product specifications
  • Bring the business and user goals to the design and implementation planning conversation with the architect 
  • Build high-quality requirements with clear acceptance criteria that can easily be broken down into chunks for agile development 
  • Develop project plans & participate in release process - manage risks, communicate product needs and surface issues to cross-functional teams and key stakeholders
  • Collaborate on detailed release planning and cross-functional coordination throughout the organization
  • Delivery detailed product updates that facilitate understanding in sales, customer success, and marketing
  • Gather requirements and guide the development team to deliver a minimum viable product and subsequent iterations that provide incremental value to the business
  • Identify Beta users and leverage feature toggles to assist with staged release of new functionality

What You’ll Need

  • 7+ years experience in product management, with demonstrated experience in rapidly building and shipping b2b products
  • Payments, accounting, tax, or API experience
  • Deep expertise in end to end agile product development 
  • Experience with feature delivery and making product tradeoffs
  • Skilled at contributing to engineering discussions around technology decisions and strategy related to a product or feature implementation approach
  • Comfortable making UX design decisions and serving as a solutions architect
  • Managing in a very fast-paced environment with multiple high-level priorities
  • Navigating through ambiguity, managing and coordinating multiple project assignments simultaneously in a fast-paced environment 

Bonus Points

  • b2b2c
  • Startup
  • Kanban
  • Continuous integration environments

Our Passion

Gig Wage builds comprehensive technology products that take into consideration how money moves through the entire gig ecosystem, not just how it gets to workers. Gig Wage’s technology is shaping the modern financial infrastructure for the future of work by tackling the complex challenge of handling contractor payroll, payments, and compliance.

Gig Wage considers accounts receivable, banking, accounts payable, consumer spending and, above all, the people that the money impacts. Our unique technology enables employers to instantly pay 1099 workers with more control, flexibility and scale, while simultaneously offering independent contractors a convenient and efficient way to receive payments. We do this in all 50 states.

Our People 

We know that people have passions, problems, pains, and potential so we approach every situation with empathy. We authentically care. Gig Wagers are focused, ambitious, and excited about inspiring others to do more and go further. We embrace complex problems and love simple solutions. People trust us with their money and we are relentlessly committed to exceeding their expectations. 

At Gig Wage, we lead with empathy and move with commitment -- that includes our employees.  Our commitment to diversity in age, race, abilities, sexual orientation, ethnicity, gender identity, and points of view, creates a better workplace for our people and a better product for our customers. We view diversity as an innovation multiplier. We're building a culture where we'd want to work, where equity and inclusion provides everyone a space to belong and be themselves.  Read more on our commitment to DEI from our CEO. 

Our Perks

We empower our people to do their best work and trust them to deliver. We want all of our people to have what they need to be healthy and happy. That means our team can work remotely or in the office. We also offer unlimited PTO (that we actually want you to use), and we’re proud to provide top of the line medical, vision, dental, and telemedicine on top of a growing range of financial health services for you and your family. We know your best work happens in your best health and we take this very seriously.

jobs.title: Product Owner
jobs.description:
How we help our customers

Fospha is the market leading direct to consumer growth platform, with an ever-growing list of clients includes many well-known, innovative brands. We help them stop wasting money and find opportunities to grow. Our product delivers the most precise, independent measurement of marketing activities. We do this better than anyone else in the world. Our clients reach their full potential, acquiring and retaining customers sustainably, forever.

Fospha is part of the Blenheim Chalcot Group, with combined sales in excess of £350m and £500m of assets under management. We’ve been operating fully remotely since March 2020 but are excited about moving in to our new workspace - ScaleSpace – a shared hub with our partners at Imperial College which will bring London’s brightest minds under the same roof, creating a unique ecosystem to foster innovation and disruptive technology; though we’re committed to retaining the positives of remote work and allow WFH ongoing.

The Role

We believe our people are great at what they do because they are smart, resilient and adaptable. They can quickly navigate their thinking between different hierarchical levels and are willing to get their hands dirty to get the job done, no matter what their job title.

Key Responsibilities

  • Grow Fospha further with responsibility for the product backlog powering our products, navigating from our strategy to detail, enabling us to scale our vision globally; you're an in empowering tech teams to build great products
  • Work with our Research and Development team through discovery, quickly iterating from pretotype to test with customers to collect evidence for product initiatives
  • Work with Sales and Customer Success to systematically gather data on customer pains – what they need but can’t envision -and give back by providing expertise and collateral to support customer-facing teams
  • Plan and track key product metrics to measure and plan improvements, working with the Operations team to measure and optimise time to value
  • Rigorous and committed to providing quality deliveries you will work with our engineers to ensure QA tech & processes are operating effectively
  • Able to articulate and communicate complexity, you’re technically knowledgeable and conversant with the wider MarTech/data ecosystem; you add value with your expertise and own decisions to protect your most valuable assets – the engineering team’s time and focus

Professional Requirements

  • Demonstrable Product Owner experience, within Advertising/Marketing Technology would be a plus
  • Excellent working knowledge of JIRA
  • Demonstrable interest or experience in Data Science, AI, Digital & Performance Marketing, Measurement and Attribution, eCommerce (at least one of… more is better)
  • Experience working with Google Analytics/Marketing Cloud, Facebook Business Manager, Shopify and/or other analytics/eComm platforms
  • Engineering/Data Science experience helpful, but not a pre-requisite if you have enough applicable experience in tech

Personal Requirements

You will be able to demonstrate examples of our core principles:

  • Embrace teamwork and collaboration
  • Honest and open-minded
  • Take responsibility for making things happen

Above all, our people show a willingness to work together and get their hands dirty to deliver product success, which means our clients are successful.

A Great Opportunity

You will be a key part of our growing company; at the cross-roads of Engineering, Data Science, Sales, Marketing... the right candidate has a great opportunity to make their mark within our rapidly growing business.

Career Development

  • Ongoing coaching in delivery & leadership
  • Opportunities to partake in structured training and leadership development programmes as part of Blenheim Chalcot
  • Extensive opportunities for progression

Benefits

Competitive salary, pension scheme, private healthcare, work perks scheme, when not in lockdown we have great social events such as go karting, bowling, zip lining, paintball. We're constantly growing our benefits package.

Additional Perks

Due to move in to modern campus office at Scalespace in West London, local discounts at restaurants and gyms, yoga class, nail salon, in office hair cuts service, full calendar of social events, screenings of films, TED talks, sports tournaments… and we fully accommodate the new working paradigm, the days of presenteeism are over.

Why Us?.

Many problems are difficult to solve, especially at scale. They take the right team and environment. We are a mix of individuals from data scientists and engineers to marketers and entrepreneurs. We have very different personalities. We are united by a set of values, by a passion for solving big problems.

jobs.title: Product Manager (w/m/d)
jobs.description:
Company Description

At Kubermatic, we believe that businesses should focus on their core purpose: writing groundbreaking applications, not operations. In line with our commitment to make Kubernetes as easy as possible, we help IT teams worldwide to fully automate their Kubernetes and cloud-native operations across multi-cloud, edge, and on-prem. 

As one of the top 5 corporate contributors to the Kubernetes Project, we develop enterprise-grade software solutions and provide professional services and support to safely navigate and accelerate your cloud-native transformation. Our open-source Kubermatic Kubernetes Platform makes it easy to operate thousands of Kubernetes clusters on any infrastructure.

If you are looking for a neatly structured environment, we are just not a good match. But if you are thrilled by the prospect of joining a technology start-up with a lot of room for your own ideas and personal growth, we definitely should at least have a chat.



Job Description

We are looking for a tech-savvy Product Manager who will be responsible for our open source products, working with a distributed and international team. In close cooperation with engineering, professional services and sales, you will develop a roadmap and product backlog that makes Kubermatic and its solutions stand out in the cloud native ecosystem. As we keep growing, you will empower the development teams with the necessary user stories and issues.    

What you will be doing:  

  • Project Manager: You prioritise the backlog, coordinate between development teams and make sure that the products are constantly evolving
  • Product Designer: You determine requirements and create product concepts together with our design and engineering team
  • Open Source Community work: Track projects, evaluate them for integration and cooperation
  • Customer Liaison: You work in close collaboration with the sales and consulting teams to get first-hand customer feedback
  • Business Strategist: You shape, drive and execute the product strategy for your products in close collaboration with your team and the founders
  • Market Analyst: You validate your concepts through prototyping and user feedback. You use data to measure your technical and business success. You know your industry and are aware of the latest technologies

What you bring to the table

  • Proven success and experience in software product management in best case related to infrastructure, cloud, DevOps and IT operations 
  • Technical experience with container technologies, Kubernetes and distributed applications 
  • Experience with GTM campaigns in close alignment with product management, engineering, professional service and sales 
  • Deep customer focus and understanding  
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (mother tongue or comparable skill level) 
  • Bonus points: Experience engaging with customers in a B2B setting



Qualifications



Additional Information

What you get in return

  • A lot of room for your ideas and initiatives and the chance to quickly assume responsibility
  • Agile development practices, cutting edge technologies (Kubernetes, Go and Prometheus) and an up-to-date stack  
  • As a remote-first company, we offer flexible working hours and work from home as default, not on request 
  • A dynamic and still laid-back team (yes, you can combine that) with flat hierarchies, distributed over more than 13 countries  
  • Regular company events like hackathons, summer parties, afterworks, barbecues….

jobs.title: Growth Product Manager
jobs.description:
About Remote Year

Remote Year is a fast-growing global startup that focuses on changing peoples' stories and lives through community-based travel. Remote Year curates communities of interesting professionals, entrepreneurs, and freelancers from across the globe to travel on Retreats and 1, 4, or 12 month Work & Travel programs together. 93% of our customers report having a positive experience, and we are proud to continue to try to improve that number. As a brand, we believe that remote work is critical to a healthy work environment, and that travel while working remotely can lead to innovation, leadership, and growth.

Why work with us?

  • We offer a competitive compensation
  • You will work fully remote, like on our programs, the World is your office. Choose your base or next location
  • You will join a diverse, globally distributed team, passionate about everything "remote"
  • You will have the opportunity to join our programs

About the Role

Remote Year's looking for a creative and analytical Product Manager to own Remote Year's growth products including website and acquisition tools. The website today is the primary revenue generation engine for Remote Year, and this person would own the ultimate conversion of visitors to purchases.

We are looking for someone who will tenaciously optimize, experiment, and evaluate across the entire website experience. Working closely with a cross-functional squad of developers and designers, they will be responsible for managing the daily and weekly process, as well as liaising with technical, design, and commercial leadership. 

Success in this role will be measured by clear, quantifiable KPIs based on conversion rates at different levels of the sales funnel.

Responsibilities 

  • Identify opportunities for innovation, increased efficiencies, and outsized impact
  • Work with stakeholders to define and prioritize product backlog and roadmap
  • Break down backlog of needs into manageable user stories
  • Developing a process for evaluating value and priority level of each user story, and assigning an effort level (story points)
  • Develop a “Definition of Done” for tasks in each part of the process
  • Measuring the success or failure of piece of work and report back to stakeholders
  • Define and procure team tooling (workflow tools, process management tools, analytics tools, etc.) 
  • Analyze user behavior and data, identify new trends and take action accordingly.

Qualifications

  • 2+ years of Product Management experience
  • Strong Tech background
  • Experience in commercial B2C & B2B products
  • Experience setting up agile teams (Scrum / Kanban)
  • Creative problem-solving skills
  • Strong Analytical skills, knowing what questions to ask and where to find the data

Who You Are: 

  • Analytical - We need a data-driven decision-maker who can use analytical tools to find the data needed to back up product priorities
  • Strategic - Identify low hanging fruit, quick wins with outsized impact but balance this with long term business initiatives
  • Nimble - We need someone proven in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment who can handle multiple projects with stakeholders spanning the entire organization
  • Organized – We rely on great time management skills and the ability to stay connected and productive in a distributed work environment
  • Collaborative -  We need someone with a proven ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams 
  • Creative - You are creative in every aspect of your job and are always looking for ways to think outside the box.
  • Connected to our values - you care about travel, diversity, and experiential learning.

Diversity & Inclusion Commitment:

Remote Year is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive work environment for all employees to show up authentically and an inclusive and diverse travel environment for all of our participants to practice global empathy.

jobs.title: Product Manager (m/f/d)
jobs.description:
Talentspace is the first all-in-one live online recruiting event platform. With Talentspace we enable anyone to create online recruiting events (career fairs, recruiting events, assessment center, etc.) that are interactive and fun.

Our mission is to provide a safe, sustainable, and accessible way for people to meet, engage with, and get hired by companies, regardless of where they are.

We're one of the fastest-growing startups in Europe, recently been funded by top-tier VCs and already count organizations such as Stanford University, WHU, CEMS, Google and Microsoft as customers.

As the second Product Manager within the company you'll be empowered to take full ownership of your own product vision. You'll be responsible for continuously delivering great products that address the needs of our new and existing customers.

 

As Product Manager you will be: 

  • Lead a feature team end to end from product discovery to delivery
  • Manage the backlog for the feature team
  • Continuously critique and analyse features that we've shipped
  • Own your own roadmap and define the requirements for each development in collaboration with our stakeholders
  • Collaborate with our Product Design team in product discovery and validation

What you bring:

  • Up to 3 years experience in product management/product ownership (bonus if in a startup environment)
  • Clear understanding of the methods and techniques of product discovery and product delivery.
  • Creative and analytical thinker with strong problem solving skills;
  • Strong analytical skills and data informed mindset
  • Familiar with sales processes, operations and customers success in the B2B space;
  • Great written and verbal communication in English are essential (Bonus if you can also speak German).

What we offer: 

  • Enthusiastic team filled with diverse backgrounds and respect for different opinions
  • A great product with many exciting opportunities ahead
  • Very competitive salary plus stock options
  • A modern and well-equipped work place located at the heart of Kreuzberg, Berlin if you are around
  • Otherwise, 100% remote working is possible
  • 25 vacation days + public holidays

jobs.title: Associate Product Manager
jobs.description:
We're looking for Associate Product Managers (APMs) to help us manage delivery of features across Product, Design, Engineering, and Customer Success. APM is an entry-level to early-career Product position, which will work closely with and in support of Product Managers (PMs) and/or Group Product Managers (GPMs) as part of the broader Product Team. The APM will grow in the skills necessary to excel as a PM through hands-on experience and increasing responsibility.

Responsibilities
  • Participate in all aspects of product and feature development, including gathering requirements, prioritization, guiding design, planning/managing implementation, release, and iterative improvement
  • Conduct research and analysis in support of products, features and initiatives
  • Work closely with Product Managers / Group Product Managers
  • Collaborate with other teams, including engineering, design, data operations, marketing, and customer success
Experience & Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience; it's a plus if in the areas of product management, software development, design, business analysis, project management, product marketing, or similar
  • Very strong organizational skills; able to capture exquisite details
  • You know how to communicate clearly no matter the medium: on Slack, task trackers, video calls, emails, in person, etc
  • Experience working for a startup (or tech company) is a plus
  • Education or hands-on software development experience is a plus.
Benefits
  • Work remotely – our headquarters are in San Francisco, but we've been a distributed company from the start; work remotely anywhere in the United States
  • You'll join at an early stage of the company, so you can take something from 0 to 1
  • We're a supportive team who will give you as much assistance or independence as you like
  • We offer a full benefits package, including medical/vision/dental, 401(k), work-from-home budget, etc. — depending on location.
About Archipelago

Archipelago is a Silicon Valley start-up working to change how risk is insured. Our platform enables large real estate owners, managers, brokers & insurance carriers to efficiently map their portfolio, manage their risks, and underwrite them, through a mix of machine learning and human intelligence. Our founders are tech & finance entrepreneurs with several IPOs and acquisitions under their belts. We are headquartered in San Francisco, have raised several rounds of VC funding, and currently employ over one hundred people across the US & Europe.

We're only able to consider applicants based in the United States at this time. (You can work remotely anywhere in the United States. Once it is safe to do so, you'll be welcome to work from our San Francisco office as well, if that is what you prefer.)

jobs.title: Product Manager, B2B SaaS
jobs.description:
Leadfeeder is a fast-growing international SaaS startup headquartered in Finland. We are on a mission to bring web intelligence to our customers. Simply put, Leadfeeder helps companies know more about their website traffic, which enables them to convert promising visitors into sales and marketing leads.

We are a remote-first company, which means you can work wherever you prefer as long as you are physically located in Europe. To support our distributed setup, we have a culture of transparency, ownership, and collaboration.

We love our casual dress code, company retreats, and the opportunity to work with a truly diverse 120+ strong team based in 25 countries.

We are organised in feature-oriented, cross-functional squads. Each squad is responsible for specific features of the product and works tightly together with high autonomy. Depending on the product area, squads are composed of Backend and Frontend Engineers, Designers, and are always paired with a Product Manager.

We believe in listening to everyone's ideas and feedback.

Responsibilities:

We are looking for a Product Manager to join our Europe based R&D team, reporting to the CTO.

This is an exciting time to join Leadfeeder, as we are moving from a solid, well-rounded product to multiple products, which will put you in an ideal position of shaping the future of the company while having the opportunity to grow and develop both personally and professionally.

As Product Manager, you will create and implement the product vision and strategy to continuously drive value and customer success.

  • Act as a servant leader in one of our development squads
  • Compile product requirements, develop and manage the product roadmap, manage the delivery of product features, and assess impact
  • Act as guardian of quality of work and delivery at all times
  • Improve our discovery process by working closely with customers
  • Implement the findings in product development by working closely with the Engineering, Design, Marketing, Sales and Customer Success teams
  • As we are a remote-first company, you can expect to spend more time writing down and presenting your ideas and initiatives than in an office-based company
  • Contribute actively on a continuous basis to quantitive and qualitative client research, to be the voice of the customer. This might be anything from test driving new ideas with engaged clients to analysing a features’ post-launch feedback and usage to iterate on it.

Requirements

  • Product Management experience in a SaaS company, with a track record of successful product delivery in the market
  • Strong understanding of B2B sales and/or marketing, with a high level of customer understanding
  • Entrepreneurial and independent way of working, with an eye for identifying risks
  • Analytical and structured mindset; natural curious, outcome-oriented and proactive personality
  • Able to challenge status-quo, ask hard questions, validate assumptions, and make sure dots connect on product goals
  • A well-balanced combination of technical knowledge and business acumen
  • Prior experience of setting the framework for experiments, analysing the results and suggesting next action points
  • Skills in analytics, UX, user research, CRMs and other revolving expertise around product management are also appreciated
  • Understanding of software development life-cycle and challenges
  • Comfortable with customer interactions and interviews
  • Excellent written and spoken English
  • Be based within European timezones

Benefits

  • The chance to work with a very knowledgeable, high-achieving and fun team
  • Considerate, open-minded and supportive working environment
  • The chance to be part of a rapidly growing startup and the next success story
  • Personal budget for home office improvements
  • Company provided hardware or monthly financial support for using your own equipment
  • Up to 12 paid local bank holidays per year
  • Flexible working hours
  • Access to weekly yoga / fitness / meditation classes online
  • Mental Health support
  • Bi-annual company retreats that we will resume once Corona allows it

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager - Workforce Management
jobs.description:
Company Description


Job Description

Procore is looking for a Senior Product Manager - Workforce Management to help us accelerate our market-leading Labor Management solution and drive significant revenue growth in our Resource Management product line over the next three years. In this role, you will own the strategy and execution to grow our Labor Management solutions by solving new problems that delight our customers and ensuring a seamless onboarding experience that will drive rapid adoption and engagement with our users. 

As a Senior Product Manager, you have a deep background in product management, are comfortable collaborating with multiple stakeholders, and can balance competing priorities with ease. You have proven experience digging into customer problems, distilling them into needs, and envisioning the best solutions to meet and exceed them. If you can operate with a high degree of autonomy, have strong leadership skills, and are great at driving alignment—we’d like to hear from you!

This position will report to the Group Product Manager for Specialty Contractors and has the opportunity to work remotely from a US location, or in our New York, NY, Carpinteria, CA or Austin, TX office. We’re looking for someone to join our team immediately.

What you’ll do: 

  • Partner with UX Designers and Engineers to create a more powerful and usable platform that helps our customers improve the value they see from the product and generates improved CAC and retention for Procore

  • Develop a deep understanding of our strategy; evangelize the product vision across the organization to ensure alignment and buy-in

  • Work closely with customers and go-to-market teams to think beyond software and deliver a whole solution

  • Effectively use qualitative and quantitative data analysis to help inform the decision-making process

  • Become well-versed in the construction industry and its diverse collaboration challenges in order to guide and communicate the value you’re creating for our customers

  • Balance customer empathy with horizontal solution thinking—recognize platform approaches that solve multiple problems at once, creating strategic leverage for Procore

What we’re looking for:

  • Bachelor’s degree is preferred, or equivalent experience

  • 5+ years of Product Management experience at a B2B software company

  • History of delivering innovative products to market with a customer value-driven approach

  • Expert level ability to work with go-to-market teams

  • Proven track record of developing cross-functional partnerships across Product and Revenue teams that drive successful outcomes

  • Strong analysis and synthesis skills, demonstrating the ability to break down problems into components that are then structured into systemic solutions

  • Strong listening and communication skills; Product Management is equally about inquiring as it is advocating



Qualifications


Additional Information

If you'd like to stay in touch and be the first to hear about new roles at Procore, join our Talent Community.

About Us

Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes, and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore. 

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome builders of all backgrounds. We thrive in a diverse, dynamic, and inclusive environment. We do not tolerate discrimination against employees on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.

Perks & Benefits

You are a person with dreams, goals, and ambitions—both personally and professionally. That's why we believe in providing benefits that not only match our Procore values (Openness, Optimism, and Ownership) but enhance the lives of our team members. Here are just a few of our benefit offerings: generous paid vacation, employee stock purchase plan, enrichment and development programs, and friends and family events.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
BiggerPockets is the leading network of real estate investors. Our mission is to help people build wealth and achieve financial freedom through real estate investing. We empower investors to build wealth faster, with less risk, through expert content on every aspect of real estate investing, access to an engaged community of over 2 million investors, and a robust suite of tools to find, finance, and analyze investments.


EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

BiggerPockets is proud to be an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBTQ+ employer.

We celebrate, support, and encourage being different for the benefit of our team members and community. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, political affiliation, marital status, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, genetic information, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, veteran status or other non-merit factors.

About the role:

BiggerPockets is seeking a results-driven Product Manager to own the membership experience for our 2 million members. They will have the opportunity to build a personalized experience that transforms how our members make real estate investments.


What you’ll do:

  • Build and manage a best-in-class community forum experience - from searching for content, surfacing relevant topics, posting questions to the community, engaging in lively debate and upgrading to paid memberships.

Minimal travel is required for this position

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
About Us

The Modern Milkman started with four friends, one beat up truck, and a mission - to create a purpose driven business that revolutionises consumer habits by delivering fresh ways to reduce waste. We’ve grown a lot since we first began (goodbye beat up truck!). Our team is full of passionate and ambitious individuals, ready to revolutionize consumer habits in new and exciting ways. When you work with us, you’ll discover it’s truly a team effort, and you’ll find yourself collaborating with different departments on a daily basis. But don’t worry, we don’t take ourselves too seriously – where’s the fun in that?

Say it loud, we’re green and we’re proud!

So whether your passion lies with saving the turtles, keeping your neighborhood clean, or shopping ethically, you’ll find a place with the Modern Milkman. We’re looking for enthusiastic people with strong ethics who care about the planet, as well as our working environment. We want you to feel proud of the company and the vital work you’re doing to reduce waste and keep our oceans clean - the turtles will thank you! Above all, we want you to thrive in your role.

What makes us tick

You’ll quickly find that our values are part of our DNA, and run through everything we do at the Modern Milkman. They allow us to help make a difference in the world and are worth more than any monetary gains.

  • We do the right thing
  • We’ve got something to say
  • We’re stronger together
  • We laugh in the face of the fun police

Our Commitment to Diversity

Here at the Modern Milkman, we’re made up of people from all walks of life - it’s what makes our team so amazing! We are committed to hiring great people from a wide variety of backgrounds and love that we are all different. If you share our values and our purpose, continue reading to find out more about our current employment opportunity.

What we’re proud of

Sure we’ve been selected as one of Northwest Business Insider's Most Exciting Companies, but as of July 30th, 2021, we’ve saved over 20,000,000 plastic bottles. Now that’s something to celebrate!

What’s the Opportunity?

 

As a Product Manager, you will own the product vision and roadmap making sure efficiently it delivers to the business priorities working with senior management. You will be leading a team of product owners and/or business analyst. As an active member of the delivery teams, you will ensure the team have a cleaner understanding of the requirements and business context.

Requirements

What you'll need

  • Experience of leading a product, its vision, value and roadmap
  • Demonstrable experience of delivery of business objectives through a well-defined, streamlined product.
  • Good understanding of ecommerce/supply chain/logistics
  • Relevant industry experience developing products for logistics/last mile business, perfect example would be Picnic/Doordash/DPD/Deliveroo etc.
  • Experience of tools such as Jira and Aha

Ideally you will have

  • CSPO certified or similar
  • Previous experience of working with a blend of onshore and remote teams

 

 

Benefits

The Modern Milkman is an amazing business to work in with a super exciting and executable vision. Our team members are rewarded well, not only from a salary perspective but also with:

  • £65,000 - £70,000pa dependent on experience
  • 4.5% matched pension contributions
  • 25 days leave plus bank holidays
  • A day off for your birthday!
  • Employee discount on TMM
  • Life insurance with Aviva +25% off gym membership
  • A company mission that’s damn easy to get behind – save our planet!

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager, Structured Data - Product
jobs.description:
Company Description

Wish is a mobile e-commerce platform that flips traditional shopping on its head. We connect hundreds of millions of people with the widest selection of delightful, surprising, and—most importantly—affordable products delivered directly to their doors. Each day on Wish, millions of customers in more than 160 countries around the world discover new products. For our over 1 million merchant partners, anyone with a good idea and a mobile phone can instantly tap into a global market.

We're fueled by creating unique products and experiences that give people access to a new type of commerce, where all are welcome. If you’ve been searching for a supportive environment to chase your curiosity and use data to investigate the questions that matter most to you, this is the place.



Job Description

The Marketplace & Logistics team is the entry point for millions of merchants  from all over the world who interact and sell through our platform. We deliver on many large scale initiatives which include integration, payment processing, logistics and fulfillment, and tracking to name a few. Whether it be delivering a platform to onboard new merchants in new geographies, improving our returns process, or scaling our logistics practice to process more than 3 million transactions per day, you will be able to impact the business on a global scale.

What you will be doing:

  • Work closely with stakeholders from engineering, design, data, and research to create a more robust and structured method of collecting, attributing, and storing product & listing data on the Wish platform
  • Develop a product vision and roadmap to deliver success with how Wish structures data
  • Lead initiatives around automating data attribution, data labelling, and ensuring legal compliance
  • Use research, customer feedback, data, and analysis to prioritize projects and features that will deliver on business objectives
  • Accurately assess success metrics of products and create processes that increase success rates

#LI-AS1 #LI-REMOTE



Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in computer science, engineering, or business management 
  • 7+ year of experience in product management or related disciplines
  • Strong quantitative analysis skills, detail oriented and data driven approach to problem solving
  • Strong communication and project management skills with the ability to work with multiple stakeholders, manage stakeholder relationships and prioritize stakeholder requests.
  • Experience managing ambiguity, complexity, and interdependencies within a product development cycle
  • Self-motivated, self-directed, and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Curiosity and desire to learn

Not located in the Bay Area? Remote work is acceptable! (*US, Canada, and Europe)



Additional Information

Wish values diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate based on any legally-protected class or characteristic. Employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability, please let your recruiter know. For job positions in San Francisco, CA, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Individuals applying for positions at Wish, including California residents, can see our privacy policy here.

jobs.title: Director of Product
jobs.description:
Here at Faraway, we are making massively social, blockchain games. We believe in open economies, true digital ownership, and most importantly, that “fun” is a store of value.

Our ideal teammates are low ego, hard-working, and self-motivating. Our culture is based around hard work, high ownership, leading by example, and last but not least, always doing the right thing by our community. If this sounds like a team you’d like to join, then continue reading. 👾

About this Role

As the Director of Product for Mini Royale: Nations, you will be an expert in all areas of product management including monetization and retention mechanics, economy balancing, and game events that support retention and engagement. You will work with multi-disciplinary teams from product conception and throughout production to shape and thoroughly document the product strategy, including feature sets, merchandising, purchasing drivers, pricing, and other success factors. You must have a deep understanding of free-to-play game design and live ops, but you must never forget that an open economy and governance model is a paradigm shift in how you must approach the problem.🕹️

Responsibilities

  • Conceptualise, design, and prepare documentation and user stories for new features and content including game modes, meta progression, rule-based events, among others.
  • Develop a deep understanding of our players: their problems, their needs, their desires, and translate them into exceptional experiences.
  • Work with Producers to schedule and scope features, providing them with the necessary system design documentation and mockups to deliver to art, engineering, and QA teams.
  • Leverage business intelligence, user analytics, and quant+qual analysis to monitor the fun and health of the game, economy, and community; prioritize product features that promote retention and long-term economic health.
  • Research the latest blockchain and free-to-play design models and implement these best practices into the economy
  • Work hard and lead by example.

Requirements

  • Must be passionate about games and the interaction of blockchain and gaming
  • 10+ years of experience as a PM or Data Analyst on a successful free-to-play game or highly social consumer product.
  • Expert understanding of game system and economy design and player psychology
  • Ability to work closely with technical teams to design and implement features and systems that our community will love
  • Advanced Excel/Economy Modeling, Data Visualization, and Presentation skills
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics / Economics / Finance, or another quantitative field
  • Love for games 🎮

Desired Skills

  • Deep understanding of midcore free-to-play games and live ops
  • Experience contributing to risk and profitability decisions in a marketplace setting
  • Masters or PhD in Economics with a focus on Mechanism Design or Contract Theory

Location

Remote 🌎

jobs.title: Director of Product, Foundation
jobs.description:
Nomad Health is the first digital marketplace for healthcare jobs, efficiently connecting quality clinicians with rewarding career opportunities. Forbes recognized Nomad as one of the “Best Startup Employers”, Newsweek included Nomad on its "Most Loved Workplaces" list, and Built In NYC named Nomad one of the “Best Mid-Sized Companies To Work For.” Our technology takes the busywork out of finding clinical work. We are a well-funded Series D startup backed by First Round Capital, RRE Ventures, .406 Ventures, Polaris Partners, Icon Ventures, Adams Street Partners, and Kevin Ryan (founder of MongoDB, Zola, Gilt, and DoubleClick). 
 
The U.S. healthcare system is experiencing a staffing crisis. Employers spend $20 billion per year recruiting clinicians to care for the rapidly aging U.S. population. Nomad replaces antiquated staffing agencies with modern technology to efficiently source, qualify, and hire medical talent on demand. Clinicians find better jobs with higher pay. Employers fill roles faster with higher quality care.  
 
Nomad is a fast growing team of technologists, creators, and industry experts passionate about modernizing healthcare staffing so clinicians can get back to the work they do best: caring for others.
 
We’re looking for amazing Product leadership talent to drive the development of of the internal tools and capabilities which are core to Nomad's mission of removing every obstacle between providers and the patients they care for.
 
What will you do at Nomad?
As the Director of Product, reporting directly to the VP Product, you will lead a team focused on delivering critical platform technologies and experiences which enable internal teams to build delightfully effective experiences for our users.  This is a business-critical space in which we will continue to redefine how the industry works.  At Nomad you will:
 
• Be the champion for our internal teams by owning the vision and mission for our platforms and services.
• Be accountable for the product strategy and roadmap. Lead teams to best prioritize their work towards both maximizing business value and excellence in product design, development and customer experience.
• Recruit high caliber Product team members as Nomad continues its growth and expansion, and act as a key contributor to Product team culture, product best practices, effective collaboration across scrum teams, and with the rest of the business.
• Coach, mentor, and inspire Product managers and individual contributors in the Product organization on technical and career development.
• Combine outstanding business sense and alignment with enterprise value. Work closely and effectively with business stakeholders in scoping and prioritizing product work, communicating releases and measuring results, and iterate the process.
• Lead by example. Very technically involved in coaching and driving product design, development discussions and decisions with members of the team, and through product specs and product review activities.
• Build strong relationships with your partners who are Engineering Managers, Operations, Data Analysts, and more. Collaborate with business functions to deliver best technology value to our users through your products.
• Be involved in the Agile process at Nomad, such as sprint planning, retrospective meetings, standups and spec reviews. Hold your scrum team product managers accountable for and help them with milestones and deliveries.
Who Are You? 
• Proven experience in leading multiple Product and Engineering initiatives at growth stage technology startups, managing multiple scrum teams and coaching Product managers, and scrum team members.
• Highly technical, able to lead architectural conversations with engineers on topics as varied as communications platforms, ML-based solutions, unified data models, and more.  You likely have a computer science background.
• Proven experience defining software and platforms for B2B or internal operations, such as HR technology, recruiting and applicant tracking systems, customer relationship management, labor marketplaces, project or document management.
• Strong product vision and execution skills. You have a strong opinion on the products you build and the value it creates in the longer term. You also set optimized milestones and lead the teams to execute prioritized work to achieve your goals.
• Customer obsession. You are obsessed with talking to your customers, absorbing their problems, and bringing to life solutions that matter to them. You take pride in earning customers’ trust and they decide to use your product because it’s delightful and useful.
• An empathic people leader who is as passionate about developing product team members as they are about developing their products, and has experience leading and growing complex technology functions with scrum teams of 30+ product and engineering members.
• Outstanding analytical skills, and ability to analyze user data, think creatively and solve problems with data-driven decision making.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to clearly and concisely articulate product concept, goals, tasks and deliverables to cross functional collaborators in a distributed and remote-enabled team setting.
 
Nomad offers a fast-paced, supportive, diverse culture. Benefits include comprehensive health, dental, and vision plans, 401k matching, and remote work perks until we’re back in the office!  
 
Exciting challenges lie ahead. Join us! Let's get to work.

jobs.title: Principal Product Manager, Hardware
jobs.description:
We’re looking for open-minded individuals who want to expand the ways technology can help people. We work fast, collaborate, and celebrate as a team. We’re united by a commitment to shaping Tile’s culture around the needs of our colleagues and customers, and by our desire to build a diverse and welcoming workplace.
 
 
We’re hiring a Principal Product Manager to lead our lineup of hardware devices. Tile makes a family of bluetooth trackers that help our customers find items like keys, wallets, backpacks, and anything else that is important to them. As the lead for hardware, you’ll define hardware strategy, product lineup, hardware requirements, drive the industrial design, quality and ultimately customer satisfaction with Tile’s first-party devices.  
 
You’ll work in partnership with Hardware and Firmware Engineers, Product Marketing, Research, and other Product Managers to create a compelling lineup that is in line with Tile’s vision to be the most comprehensive finding service for consumers.



Responsibilities:
  • Establish and communicate the Hardware strategy and lineup 
  • Develop short-term and long-term product roadmaps
  • Earn the trust of stakeholders by developing sound rationale for all product decisions 
  • Validate Product decisions through research, data, and in-field testing
  • Prioritize product decisions and tradeoffs in order to meet customer needs while also balancing the needs of the business
  • Partner with engineer teams to deliver high quality products that provide the best possible customer experience
  • Partner with engineering, operations and sales leads to ensure delivery of product to channel on time and in volume to meet forecast
  • Ensure general quality and a great customer experience through the life of the product
  • Identify and evaluate new markets and opportunities for Tile hardware



You might be a good fit if:
  • You’ve shipped amazing products. You have 5+ years of hardware product management experience, with multiple product launches under your belt
  • You have deep empathy for user needs. You love talking to users, and you have multiple approaches for knowing what matters to them and why
  • You communicate clearly. You can clearly communicate with different internal stakeholders. You recognize what the Engineers need communicated vs what Executives are interested in. You enjoy turning ambiguity into action plans. You are as comfortable articulating vision and strategy as you are writing detailed product requirements
  • You love keeping teams in sync. You have exceptional organizational skills, and you develop lightweight processes to ensure cross-functional teams are moving in the same direction
  • You ask and answer the right questions. You develop smart hypotheses and have a knack for designing research and experiments to prove them. You love data, and know how to interpret and think critically about results
  • You are technical. You are a thought partner in technical design decisions, and you ask your engineering counterparts the right questions. You recognize the risks with decisions in the manufacturing process

Basic Qualifications:
  • 5+ years of hardware product management 
  • Track record of defining and launching consumer facing products
  • Expert in hardware development process



Benefits:
  • Own equity in the company - every employee is a stakeholder in our future
  • Work with an adept team of people who love what they do
  • Flexible work program
