jobs.title: Senior Product Manager, Payment Services
jobs.description:
Company Description

Nets is the European leader in eCommerce and point of sale payments, active in over 25 countries across Europe, serving over 2m merchants and more than 1200 financial institutions. We are dedicated to a truly local experience for customers in every country in Europe. We strive to build products that customers will love and merchants will thrive using. We are a high volume low margin company trying to make all the goods and services that you love buyable - without earning money off of consumer interest fees.  

 



Job Description

This job will be in the Payment Services team, a newly formed group at Nets, who will create a next generation distributed payments processing system for Nets eCommerce and Point of Sale. The team consists mainly of payment developers from a variety of backgrounds who are primarily “hands on keyboard” working on Azure cloud and whose primary product is a set of robust RESTful APIs. The team has a digital first approach (even post pandemic), a modern, green field tech stack built on Azure. The goal of the team is to be the central payment processing connector for the entirety of Nets and third party PSPs. 

Within this group at Nets, we empower our product teams to operate with full ownership to define their strategy, vision and how we can best economically solve it. The product teams have high visibility from executive management who attend demos and engagement with the work being done. Product managers are empowered to take ownership and solve the core problem and articulate their vision. We staff the teams with the right people needed to assist in solving the problem. They are fully accountable for the results of their teams and responsible for steering decisions based on deep knowledge of our customers, usage data of our products, company goals, industry trends, and the competitive landscape relevant to their products. 

Net’s Product Payment services group is an ambitious new team who is recruiting actively from a diverse candidate set. This job is right for you if you would rather deliver value instead of delivering a PowerPoint, if you prioritize working with smart people who strive for clear communication over byzantine processes. We aim to be the most scalable and largest payment solution platform in Europe. 

 

Core Responsibilities 

  • Own the end to end product on behalf of Nets 

  • Have end to end responsibility over your product, it’s performance in the market  

  • Set the vision, strategy and metrics for your product. Work to get buy in from across the organization inside and outside of your team 

  • Gain a deep understanding of the markets you will operate in, what the competition is offering and the customer requirements 

  • Have a constant and dedicated focus on your customers 

  • Own your own budget and “virtual P&L” 

  • You set an inspiring vision, clear strategy and key metrics for your product on which you create buy-in and alignment throughout the organization (especially your own team) 

  • You understand markets, competition, and user requirements in depth 

  • You have a focus on your customers 

  • You lead and drive a cross-functional team 



Qualifications

  • 10+ years of Software Product Management experience leading a high functioning cross functional team 

  • Experience in take a product from idea to launch, owning product roadmap, using data to make UX decisions and providing input to technical implementation discussions 

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills (in English). 



Additional Information

Payment Services at Nets is a hub for innovation and green field work at Nets. We are a meritocracy where the best ideas win, people are given a chance to try new things and fail on their way to ultimate success.

Culture - You'll work with a diverse crowd of people from 20 different countries based in our offices around Europe and  your home office. 

Operational independence - We are the tip of the spear for innovation at Nets and you will have high visibility and high impact here at Nets. 

Compensation - You will get an above market salary, along with 30 days annual leave.

Education - We are an environment where we emphasize knowledge sharing, education, conferences and internal technical talks.

Wide reach - Nets has targets for what it wants to achieve in the next 5 years. To get there we will provide opportunities for travel across Europe to other Net's offices in Stockholm, Berlin, Milan, Oslo and more.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
👋 Hello! Orbit is hiring a Product Manager to support our global vision as we help other organizations manage over 3 million community members. This job listing is a work in progress, so check back soon for specifics about the role. (You're welcome to go ahead and apply now, but be advised that it might be a few weeks before we kick off the search and get back to you about your application.)

 

The right candidate will see solutions and know how to easily communicate with a broad range of individuals across departments, open-sourced projects, and countries. This person will have the opportunity to use their strategic and technical knowledge daily, while having a balanced work life.

 

Orbit helps organizations build enthusiastic communities of technology adopters. Our platform helps companies identify, measure, and improve their community members’ engagement, all while focusing on creating value instead of merely capturing it. We are former developer advocates and community builders ourselves, and now we are creating the tools we wished we had so that others can build highly engaged communities of their own.

 

It is important to love where you work and know what you are creating is making a positive impact on the world around you. At Orbit we focus on the love of what we do so we can support one another while equipping community builders with data and tools to deliver a great community member experience.

 

We're still writing this section. Check back soon! In the meantime, read on to learn more about working at Orbit.

 

Working at Orbit

Orbit is a remote-first, fully distributed company with employees all over the world. To make sure our team has some overlap time to meet synchronously, we limit our hiring to candidates in time zones between UTC-7 and UTC+3. If you happen to live in San Francisco or Paris, you have the option to join other members of the team at a small outpost, but this is not required (and as such, we don’t offer relocation to those cities). We do not offer visa sponsorship at this time.

 

We offer to all employees:

  • Competitive compensation including salary and stock options

  • Flexible and family-friendly working arrangements

  • Your dream hardware, software, and conferencing setup for your home office

  • Opportunities for professional development, which might include books, courses, conferences, or community events

     

Need something not listed here? Let’s talk about it! At Orbit, we have teammates around the world, so certain benefits (like medical and retirement) will vary based on where you live. We take the health and well-being of our teammates seriously. Just tell us what you need to be happy and successful, and we’ll try our best to accommodate.

The hiring process

We are a young startup, frequently iterating on our interview processes. The specific steps you go through may vary, but for all candidates, we hold the following principles in mind:

  • Everyone hears back from us, no matter the decision. At Orbit, nobody’s application falls into a black hole.

  • We respect candidates’ time and energy. We will strive for a 2-3 week interview process, unless you request more time.

  • We conduct conversational interviews as well as collaboration sessions, which are designed to help you get a sense of what it’s really like to work with our team.

  • We want everyone, candidates as well as interviewers, to come away feeling positive about the experience. Everyone should feel that they got something out of meeting and exploring the opportunity together, even if an offer isn’t extended or accepted.

And most importantly:

Orbit does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class. We support workplace diversity. In fact, we strongly believe that diversity contributes to a broader collective perspective that will consistently lead to a better company and better products. We are working hard to increase the diversity of our team wherever we can and we actively encourage everyone to consider becoming a part of it.

jobs.title: Product Manager - Media Workflows - OTT
jobs.description:
Who we are?

It's an amazing time to join Dalet as we continue to shape the future of media production, management and distribution. Mature and stable like a large corporation, yet agile and growing like a start-up, Dalet is the perfect place for talented, internationally minded and highly motivated individuals looking to join a very dynamic company where things get done.

 

Dalet empowers media-rich organizations to transform their production and distribution workflows – accelerating media operations, maximizing collaboration and creating higher value from content. As a leading media technology and service provider with over three decades of innovation, our software solutions enable greater control, enhanced visibility and increased productivity for content professionals and storytellers around the globe.

 

Leading organizations such as Fox Networks Group, Arsenal Football Club, MediaCorp, Audi, and the BBC trust Dalet to support their daily content operations. Our team is driven by a passion for media and committed to empowering a world where compelling stories are beautifully made, effortlessly told and thoughtfully delivered.

 

Learn more at www.dalet.com and https://www.linkedin.com/company/dalet-digital-media-systems

 

Role Description

Dalet Flex is  a configurable content supply chain solution that resolves the multi-platform delivery needs of today’s content creators and distributors.  To support the increasing success of this product, the Product Management department is looking for a Product Manager to join the existing team, contribute to the evolution of the Dalet Flex product, with a specific focus on OVP/OTT workflows.


This role in the Product Management team will actively interact with Customers, Prospects, Presales, Marketing, R&D and Customer Success and handle the following responsibilities :

  • Define functional and non-functional requirements regarding Media Workflows, with a focus on the content delivery
  • Specify the key functionalities to deliver agility, flexibility, ease of integration in the supply chain, functional richness and a compelling user experience
  • Ensure the creation of cloud native next generation services allowing a consumption in subscription and SaaS modes

 

Responsibilities

Collaborate with the Marketing, Product Marketing, Sales and Presales teams to build a product roadmap

  • Based on the market analysis and competitive research of Product Marketing, as well as on the feedbacks gathered from customers and prospects, identify and understand problems and opportunities
  • Build and maintain a roadmap in line with the market goals (high-level requirements and milestones)
  • Identify the unique selling points of the product in the targeted markets to prioritize their development

Contribute to the promotion of the product internally and externally:

  • Contribute to the evangelization of the product during private or public events, such as conventions, on-line events, presentations to customer, prospects or partners.
  • Support the sales force for product related questions
  • Be the reference point on technical and functional aspects of the product
  • Write and maintain the technical product associated documentation (datasheet, release notes)

Define and evolve the product in collaboration with R&D and Customer Success:

  • Write detailed requirements in interaction with R&D
  • Define the user experience and interfaces in interaction with the UI/UX team
  • Support the development of the product by clarifying open issues raised by R&D
  • Maintain a documentation of the associated costs required to deliver and operate the product
  • Manage the release plan (content and delivery milestones)
  • Continuously improve the customer journey with the Customer Success team
  • Identify and resolve issues pro-actively (internal process, sales queries, trade-offs, priority calls) which can impact the corporate goals (delay, technical issues, risks).
  • Proven experience in OVP/OTT distribution workflows (Live and VOD) and architectures (CMS, Player, Storage and CDN, payment gateway, analytics, Ads management, encoding, live streaming, DRM, user management)
  • At least 3 years of Product Management experience, preferably on a B2B SaaS product.
  • Practical experience in cloud native architectures, technologies(Kubernetes, Docker, Linux) and concepts.
  • Experience working with Cloud/SaaS services such as Amazon AWS, Google Cloud and Microsoft Azure
  • A thoughtful leader, customer centric, who instills confidence and is also able to get into the weeds.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate both verbally and in writing a compelling vision.
  • Used to working in an international distributed team environment, with large projects and in complex organizations.
  • Disciplined and results oriented. Must be entrepreneurial with a high-level of energy, intensity, dedication, and an unrelenting drive to succeed and win.
  • Ability to prioritize, negotiate, and work with a variety of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Fluent in English (written and spoken).
  • Travel, when safe to do so, will be required to participate in internal/external meetings: up to a quarter of the time.

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager - AI Projects
jobs.description:
Company Description

When you join Turnitin, you'll be welcomed into a company that is a recognized innovator in the global education space. For more than 20 years, Turnitin has partnered with educational institutions to promote honesty, consistency, and fairness across all subject areas and assessment types. Over 16,000 academic institutions, publishers, and corporations use our services: Gradescope by Turnitin, iThenticate, Turnitin Feedback Studio, Turnitin Originality, Turnitin Similarity, ExamSoft, and ProctorExam.

Turnitin has offices in Australia, India, Indonesia, Japan, Korea, Mexico, the Netherlands, the Philippines, Ukraine, the United Kingdom, and the United States. Our diverse community of colleagues are all unified by a shared desire to make a difference in education. Come join us, and let's make change together.



Job Description

The AI Product Architect drives AI innovation across the entire breadth of Turnitin’s product line and helps shape the direction of AI R&D and investment by working in close collaboration with Turnitin Product Management. The role will function at the intersection of Turnitin AI, AI Integrations Engineering and Product organizations, with a strong focus on creating cross-functional alignment and clarity.

A successful AI Product Architect will be able to:

  • Influence AI-centric Product strategy and roadmaps by:

    • Successfully drive relevant AI R&D projects to a POC phase by working with product leaders and owners to define clear concept definitions and identifying areas of potentially high customer value that AI powered products or features would meaningfully address.

    • Work closely with Turnitin Product leadership, Product Managers, Product Owners, Design/UX/UI teams and relevant Engineering teams to design or inform detailed product flows and engineering plans for AI powered products and features in preparation for building AI powered MVPs from successful AI POCs.

  • Manage the build-out of production ready and customer facing AI MVP services that can be readily developed against by core engineering and app teams in close collaboration with Turnitin AI and Turnitin AI Integrations Engineering.

  • Regularly sync with Turnitin Product Owners and Product Managers to identify promising and relevant areas of expansion, iteration and/or improvement within in-production AI services to drive ongoing and continuous improvement across all AI powered products and features.



Qualifications

  • Working knowledge of Software Engineering and Development processes and project management.

  • Expert in product design, ownership, management and execution.

  • Extremely strong communications skills, especially in being able to articulate complex ideas to different audiences accurately and efficiently.

  • A fluency in AI development processes and methodologies, with a focus on a big-picture view of the various capabilities of different AI paradigms (deep learning, classification/regression, clustering, supervised and unsupervised learning, reinforcement learning, etc.).

  • Strong ability to work intersectionality and cross-functionally and operate as the primary driver of alignment in fast moving and constantly evolving contexts.

  • Excellent project management skills, especially in highly parallelized multi-project settings.

  • Ability to maintain up-to-date, accurate, and clear documentation across a multi-project, cross-functional team setting.

  • Working knowledge in running Python code and testing APIs on their own to validate and experiment with new ideas.

  • Functional knowledge of SQL and database queries to do basic/intermediate difficult data exploration.



Additional Information

Our Mission is to ensure the integrity of global education and meaningfully improve learning outcomes. 

Our Values underpin everything we do.

  • Customer Centric - We realize our mission to ensure integrity and improve learning outcomes by  putting educators and learners at the center of everything we do.
  • Passion for Learning - We seek out teammates that are constantly learning and growing and build a workplace which enables them to do so.
  • Integrity - We believe integrity is the heartbeat of Turnitin. It shapes our products, the way we treat each other, and how we work with our customers and vendors.
  • Action & Ownership - We have a bias toward action and empower teammates to make decisions.
  • One Team - We strive to break down silos, collaborate effectively, and celebrate each other’s successes.
  • Global Mindset - We respect local cultures and embrace diversity. We think globally and act locally to maximize our impact on education.

Seeing Beyond the Job Ad

At Turnitin, we recognize it’s unrealistic for candidates to fulfill 100% of the criteria in a job ad.  We encourage you to apply if you meet the majority of the requirements because we know that skills evolve over time. If you’re willing to learn and evolve alongside us, join our team!  

Turnitin, LLC is committed to the policy that all persons have equal access to its programs, facilities and employment. We strongly encourage applications from people of color, persons with disabilities, women, and the LGBTQ+ community, regardless of age, gender, religion, marital or veterans status.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
We are CirrusLabs. Our vision is to become the world’s most sought-after niche digital transformation company that helps customers realize value through innovation. Our mission is to co-create success with our customers, partners and community. Our goal is to enable employees to dream, grow and make things happen. We are committed to excellence. We are a dependable partner organization that delivers on commitments. We strive to maintain integrity with our employees and customers. Every action we take is driven by value. The core of who we are is through our well knit teams and employees.

You are the core of a values driven organization. You have an entrepreneurial spirit. You enjoy working as a part of well-knit teams. You value the team over the individual. You welcome diversity at work and within the greater community. You aren’t afraid to take risks. You appreciate a growth path with your leadership team that journeys how you can grow inside and outside of the organization. You thrive upon continuing education programs that your company sponsors to strengthen your skills and for you to become a thought leader ahead of the industry curve. You are excited about creating change because your skills can help the greater good of every customer, industry and community.

jobs.title: Product Manager, Tax
jobs.description:
Who We Are

Abound is on a mission to enable greater wealth and wellness for independent workers, resulting in increased retention, revenue, and compliance for those that serve them. Abound’s developer-friendly API lets our partners easily embed benefits into their products, setting aside enough to cover taxes, healthcare, retirement, insurance, and more. Together with our partners, we’re building the future independent workers want to work in.

By joining Abound, you'll have an opportunity to directly impact the financial security, resiliency, and independence of 68 million self-employed Americans—by reimagining the nation’s system of non-employer benefits. We're a fast growing, 100% remote fintech startup that is rapidly scaling up our customer reach and product offerings powered by the top talent in the industry. We've curated an empathetic, innovative, and dedicated company culture and we’re excited to further add to it. What will you bring to the team?

The Role

We're seeking a Product Manager to strengthen and grow Abound's suite of tax APIs. As a Product Manager, you’ll take ownership for building APIs, products, and ultimately a platform that will redefine the 1099 economy.

What You’ll Do

  • Tax is a foundational component for both Abound and our clients’ products. You will be responsible for:
    • Understanding customer usage of the Abound API, and subsequently improving it
    • Defining new features for the tax and tax-related APIs
    • Prioritizing the roadmap
  • You will manage relationships with all levels of stakeholders, from customers to colleagues. 
  • In order to define feature requirements, you’ll work closely with internal teams across Abound, especially with Engineering.
  • You will create user stories for current and future products based on the market’s problems and corresponding opportunities.
  • As a 1099 and tax subject matter expert, you will discover and relay trends and data points to the Abound team.
  • By spending time in the market, you will identify industry problems and find corresponding solutions.
  • You will conduct customer interviews and user testing, incorporating feedback to prioritize feature development and optimization.
  • You will build business models and show ROI, monitoring and enhancing  each over the product lifecycle.
  • Working with imperfect information, you will be responsible for making decisions and incorporating Abound’s vision to bring it to market.
  • Maintaining awareness of Abound’s competition, you will develop strategies to mitigate any threat.

Successful Candidates Will Have: 

  • 7+ years’ experience working with tax, finance, and related products
  • 3+ years’ experience working in a product manager or product owner role, highly desirable
  • Demonstrated in-depth knowledge and understanding of tax code at both local and federal levels, especially where it applies to 1099s
  • Demonstrated success in overseeing product development from inception to delivery and beyond
  • Strong analytical skills, with the ability to identify and develop solutions for problems before they arise
  • A strong focus on both team and customer best practices, including constant improvement through effective feedback
  • Exceptional communication skills, ability to interact with individuals at all levels both internally and externally
  • A high EQ and self-awareness to build relationships across all levels, teams, and personality types
  • An intense curiosity and hunger to learn and improve products, teams, and the organization
  • Familiarity with SQL is highly desirable
  • Experience working in a fast-growing startup is highly desirable

Why You’ll Love Working Here

  • Supportive team and inclusive culture: we recognize contributions, celebrate wins together and support each other on challenges
  • Competitive compensation package including base pay, performance bonus, and equity
  • Excellent benefits that include flexible options for health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Outcome-oriented environment: we encourage teammates to constantly reprioritize most important work and minimize unimportant tasks, be creative and automate where possible
  • Time to rest and recharge -- unlimited time off policy you really are encouraged to take as much time off as you want as long as you’re able to get your job done and you make arrangements with your team to cover you if needed
  • Just in case you’re not taking enough time off on your own, the entire team enjoys 11 Federal Holidays off (we celebrate National Savings Day in place of Columbus Day), plus two additional paid holidays that we think should be Federal Holidays: International Women's Day and Election Day. Don’t forget a paid day off for vaccines and boosters.
  • Paid parental leave for eligible employees
  • 401k plan, including maximum Federal allowed employer match (100% match up to 4% of salary)
  • Monthly reimbursements for high-speed internet and mobile phone plan and a snacks stipend

Abound is committed to the policy that all persons have equal access to its programs, facilities, and employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital, or veterans status.

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
jobs.description:
Come join our growing team!  You will have the opportunity to work in a collaborative and creative environment where your ideas matter.

Trakstar is seeking a remote Product Manager to join our evolving product portfolio. The Trakstar Product Manager, in collaboration with the engineering team and other stakeholders, imagines, designs, iterates, and produces a world-class experience that impacts hundreds of thousands of people using our SaaS products.  Leading all aspects of product releases in an agile environment, the Trakstar Product Manager prioritizes and delivers the right tools and features to support the organization’s external and internal customers thereby improving customer satisfaction and adoption for the product(s) under their direction.

This position reports to the Director of Product Management and collaborates with many departments across all brands.

What we do:
 
Trakstar is a best-in-class, unified human capital management solution that supports mid-market companies to attract, retain, and grow their employee workforce. With almost two decades of experience providing unique employee management solutions, Trakstar is an end-to-end talent management platform offering seamless applicant tracking, training, and performance solutions. In this ever-changing and remote work environment, the demand for Trakstar is growing and we are looking for employees to help scale our existing  organization.

Our company mission is to uplevel employee performance from hire to retire, because we believe people are happier and healthier when they know their work matters. We are serving 4000+ clients around the globe. At Trakstar, we hire only the best people - individuals who impress their prospects and clients with their industry knowledge of best practices and with insights into how Trakstar’s ever-expanding employee management tools can help their businesses grow and scale.

What you’ll do:

  • Work with the product team to understand the vision and overall product roadmap, customer research, and product metrics.
  • Own the product life cycle in an agile environment by assessing opportunities, crafting solutions, and delivering valuable product features.
  • Gather requirements from key stakeholders to align them with business goals.
  • Stay on top of market trends and client needs to identify competitive threats and opportunities for the expansion of the product portfolio.
  • Prioritize and balance a backlog of new features, technology & UX best practices, and improve user experiences.
  • Deliver incremental value through collaboration with remote agile development teams and product designers to plan, prioritize, and sequence work.
  • Consistently brief stakeholders on project statuses and consider feedback.
  • Work with Sales, Customer Success, and Marketing on product launch and adoption strategies.
  • Identify the organization’s largest product gaps and prioritize actionable steps that need to be taken to improve product offerings.
  • Deliver detailed use cases, workflows, and requirements well ahead of final design and engineering.
  • Respond to Engineering feedback on scope, balancing technical effort with providing the greatest value to customers.
  • Extract actionable tasks and navigate a path forward for the company’s products in the face of incomplete information.
  • Know the company’s products and the value they provide to customers.

Your qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, with emphasis in engineering, computer science or information systems a plus
  • 5+ years experience in Product Management
  • 5+ years experience building and improving a successful SaaS or cloud-based software product
  • Knowledge of applicant tracking systems, performance management systems, or HR software is a strong plus
  • Familiarity with web technologies
  • Experience developing, managing, and launching large-scale software projects
  • Track record of shipped products
  • Experience working in an Agile development process
  • Proficient in English
Compensation:
  • Competitive salary based on experience

Benefits:

  • Flexible work hours
  • Vacation days and holidays
  • Medical, dental, and life insurance
  • 13th month bonus

Trakstar is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex.

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager (m/w/d)
jobs.description:
Lead the world into a future where business and money are forces for good.

Remagine is a new paradigm in B2B Banking, offering the first Digital Business Bank that is Purpose and Impact driven. With Remagine you can take full control and responsibility over your Finances with Multi-Banking Options, Team Cards, Analytics and positive impact at every step. Welcome to banking remagined.

 

We are currently looking for a highly motivated Senior Product Manager to support our Product team.

Everyone at Remagine is someone we are all proud to work with. We celebrate diversity in people, perspectives and values. We want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work.

A few of the values we stand for are:

  1. Intentionality Matters: Through deliberate and conscious acts, we commit to manifesting our vision and mission.
  2. Never Stop Learning: We push innovation within our products and within ourselves. Constantly seek to improve and master your technical and operational excellence.
  3. See the Good in Things: The world is full of doom and gloom, why should you be too? We look at everything with a positive eye, constructive attitude and an open mind to foster an environment of optimism.
  4. Be a Trailblazer: With a resilient spirit, we are forging new, sustainable paths ahead for future generations. Our paths are bold, innovative and creative.
What's in it for you?
  • Flexible and family-friendly working hours;
  • Remote-first with support to build your home office;
  • Flat hierarchy with a high degree of autonomy and responsibility; and
  • Define the product management way of working
Your responsibilities
  • Drive product strategy and priority for your area of the product;
  • Define processes to streamline your work, but also the work with engineers and designers;
  • Work in a cross-functional team with engineers and designers and define their work packages through tickets and epics;
  • Defend user needs, informed through data, qualitative and quantitative user research;
  • Work with data team to understand and optimise metrics of the features used;
  • Define business priorities based on input from marketing, commercial, legal and finance teams.
The ideal candidate
  • 3-4+ years of experience in consumer-facing product management, ideally with mobile apps;
  • Fluent with product discovery techniques;
  • A passion for building world-class customer experiences;
  • A genuine love for collaboration and with great interpersonal skills;
  • A strong bias for action with a hands on attitude;
  • A data driven approach with at least basic data analytics skills;
  • Strong English language skills;
  • Willing to learn and to step outside your comfort zone; and
  • Mentored a junior product manager.
Nice-to-have's
  • Experience working with Fintech or another regulated industry;
  • Experience with product management of a B2B SaaS;
  • Manages one junior product manager;
  • Worked in small and fast-paced environments.
How do you get on board?
  1. Apply for one (or more!) of our positions. Our team will review your application.
  2. Receive an invite to record a short video introduction to yourself.
  3. A quick phone interview with the Department or People's Manager so you can better understand the position and we can learn more about you.
  4. Complete a technical assessment or case study to really show off your skills.
  5. Second phone interview with our Founders.
  6. Final interview with the management team.

jobs.description:

Our staff help to remove barriers and encourage students to forge their path to a better future. Each year we support more than 1 million students, one-third of whom are first-generation, as they apply to our nearly 900 diverse member colleges & universities using the Common App's free online application. If you are a technical product manager professional and want to be part of a mission-driven non-profit that uses innovative technology to advance the college admission process, Common App may be a great match for you.

As a member of the Product Management team, our Product Managers plays a key role in the continued success of the Common Application system. The Product Manager will help to define and manage the product roadmap, manage the backlog for assigned product area(s), and collaborate closely with team members in design, development, and quality assurance roles to ensure the successful definition, development, and roll-out of changes to the Common App and/or new products. Candidates with the ability to recommend specific, fact-based, product plans and features to address challenges and resolve tensions among competing priorities for software capabilities are desired. jobs.description:
Looking for a stable yet dynamic and energetic job? Want to do things that really matter? What a coincidence.

We’re Telemedi - a trusted partner in advanced digital healthcare solutions. What we do is ultimately save lives. And yes, those are big words. But we do put faith in them, and we conduct our business with this particular goal in mind.

We work in 20+ global markets, providing high-quality services of remote doctor consultations - over 100,000 per month, conducted by 500+ GPs. Familiarity with Lean Startup and Customer Development concepts. Ability of running tests (e.g. A/B tests) and interpreting both quantitative and qualitative data.

jobs.title: Director of Product Management - Ecosystem
jobs.description:
About Ease:
Ease is the #1 rated benefits administration and HR software for businesses with 2–250 employees, powered by insurance brokers. 70,000+ employers trust Ease’s innovative SaaS service model to set up and manage benefits, onboard hires, stay compliant and offer their employees one destination for all their human resources information. Headquartered in San Francisco with offices in New York, Las Vegas, and Omaha, Ease was recently ranked number 57 in Forbes 2020 list of the top 500 startup employers in America.
Ease video
 
Ease is looking for a senior product leader to manage and grow the product team responsible for Ease’s entire portfolio of partner solutions and to own our platform roadmap. The Ease platform sits at the center of a complex supply chain: small employers and their employees, insurance carriers, insurance brokers, payroll vendors, outsourcing companies (such as third-party administrators and general agents), HR tech vendors, CRM and agency management systems (AMS) … the list goes on. Ease truly is a multi-sided platform.
 
Our mission is to build a multi-sided B2B2C platform that transforms how the industry works through the automation and standardization of managing employee benefits. The challenge is large, but the opportunity is even larger. Recently we completed our series C fundraising, we have traction in the market, and are well ahead of the competition. Now it is time to scale things to the next level of growth. As such we are looking for an inspiring product leader with the right combination of business acumen, entrepreneurial mindset, technical skills, obsession with driving operational efficiency while keeping a focus on user experience (for all external and internal stakeholders). There is an organizational design and team building aspect to this role as we scale the organization in line with revenue growth. The ability to mentor and coach an energetic and talented team of product managers is a key aspect of this role.
 
Are you able to think in the large but work in the small? Can you help a team see the big picture while maintaining an attention to the level of detail needed to be successful? Do you have the necessary determination and perseverance to keep chipping away at problems, while being receptive and staying alert to potentially game changing solutions? Do you enjoy driving consensus across a broad array of internal and external stakeholders? This could be the opportunity for you!
 



Responsibilities
  • Directly manage a growing team of product managers that have day-to-day responsibilities for product managing their respective engineering teams.
  • Collaborate with the revenue and marketing organizations to define our ecosystem vision and roadmap.
  • Empower product managers in prioritizing and managing their respective backlogs and team roadmaps - while ensuring we have appropriate alignment with other stakeholders around top level business objectives.
  • Hire product managers in line with (and ahead of) growth in our engineering teams.
  • Work with engineering leadership to define our technical strategy and roadmap - to drive standardization in how partners connect to our platform via APIs.
  • Anticipate risks and determine appropriate mitigation plans as necessary.
  • Lead strategic discussions with Ease partners and influence the roadmap of our strategic partners by evangelizing Ease’s integration framework.
  • Flexibility and willingness to step into detailed work requirements as we scale the team (we are still a startup!).



Experience / Skills Desired
  • A technical background is key for this role. Some experience with enterprise integration technologies and concepts is key.
  • At least 8 years of product management experience, ideally managing product managers.
  • Some background in technical (or platform) product management is highly desirable (i.e. understanding the technical and business tradeoffs with respect to non-functional concerns; reliability; security; scalability; configurability; etc).
  • No experience with benefits industry is required, however experience with a similar B2B supply chain in a similarly complex industry is an advantage.
  • Sufficient business acumen and executive presence to convey the vision and value to non-technical stakeholders.
  • A passion for detailed feature design and problem solving. Ability to translate high level requirements into detailed product specifications.
  • Hands-on experience with Agile Development.
  • Exceptional analytical and decision-making skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to manage and inspire a team of product managers.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.

jobs.title: Product Manager, Shipping Services
jobs.description:
Company Description

Etsy is the global marketplace for unique and creative goods. We build, power, and evolve the tools and technologies that connect entrepreneurs with buyers around the world. Etsy, Inc.'s 'house of brands' portfolio has expanded to now include four individually distinct ecommerce brands – Etsy, fashion resale marketplace Depop, musical instrument marketplace Reverb, and Brazil-based handmade goods marketplace Elo7. As an Etsy employee, you’ll tackle unique problems alongside talented coworkers committed to Keeping Commerce Human. We're large enough that you'll focus on meaningful, complex challenges, but small enough that you can make a rewarding impact.



Job Description

We are looking for a Product Manager that will partner closely with our Engineering and Design Team in a brand new Etsy office based out of Mexico. This role will report directly to the Director of Product as part of the Core Fulfillment Group whose mission is to make fulfillment fulfilling.

The Shipping Services team is part of the Core Fulfillment initiative at Etsy which is responsible for creating more value in our shipping tools for our sellers. Driven by research, metrics, and long term strategy, the Shipping Services team aims to deeply understand seller motivations and make product improvements across the experience to encourage sellers to adopt best practices.

With over 100 million items offered by 5.2 million sellers, we bring value to our buyers, sellers, and Etsy by balancing e-commerce standard methodologies with the exciting challenges posed by operating at scale.

In this role you will:

  • You'll help us build fabulous products and experiences for people using our shipping platform. selling with Etsy. The teams working on each feature are small, so there's a lot of meaningful collaboration between engineers, product managers, and designers
  • Work closely and collaboratively with leaders across our other functions (including engineering, marketing, insights/analytics, and design) to realize the full scale and potential of product

This is a full-time position reporting to the Director of Product Management. We are considering remote candidates based in Mexico for this position. Etsy offers three different work modes to meet the variety of needs and preferences of our team: Flex mode for candidates who are comfortable traveling to an office location 2+ times per week, Remote mode, and Office-based mode. Learn more about our flexible work modes and vaccination policy here.



Qualifications
  • 4-6 years of Product Management experience
  • You’re passionate about Etsy’s mission and are brimming with ideas on how we could do it better
  • 2-Sided Marketplace experience a big plus
  • Successful track record solving complex consumer-facing and logistics problems, developing strategies and roadmaps, and executing those plans to bring value for our business and customers
  • Experienced with using qualitative and quantitative data (especially from synthesizing data into clear needs and hypotheses) to make product decisions 
  • You know when and how to balance data with intuition
  • Inspiring, engaging and clear communication style; optimistic and forward-looking
  • Comfortable with multitasking and can prioritize projects happening in parallel
  • A passionate member of the Etsy community and someone who believes in Etsy’s vision, mission and values



Additional Information

What's Next

If you're interested in joining the team at Etsy, please send a cover letter and resume telling us why you'd be right for the position. As you've hopefully seen already, Etsy is a place that values individuality and variety. We don't want you to be like everyone else -- we want you to be like you! So write to us and tell us what you're all about.

Our Promise

At Etsy, we believe that a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace makes us a more relevant, more competitive, and more resilient company. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. Etsy is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status. jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
jobs.description:
Voodoo is a Tech company that creates and publishes hyper-casual and casual mobile games for a wide audience. It is the worldwide leader in the mobile game market through snackable, innovative and creative content combining data and new technologies. 
 
The company raised $200M in 2018 and we have been certified a Great Place to Work France 2020 and Best Workplace 2021. More recently, Tencent has become a minority stakeholder in Voodoo, with a role in framing our strategy to dominate the Asia Pacific region. 
 
#1 worldwide in mobile game downloads, and regularly at the top of the App Store rankings, our games have about 300 million monthly active users and more than 5 billion downloads since our creation. Voodoo is one of the most impressive examples of hypergrowth in the ecosystem, having multiplied its turnover by 5 over the past few years. 
 
With more than 360 employees around the world, we would love you to apply to join an ambitious, innovative and international company!
 
What is Voodoo’s Culture all about?
We recruit passionate and creative profiles, who combine data and new technologies to disrupt the mobile market. Driven by a test-and-learn culture, we welcome wonderfully talented people wishing to undertake and manage unique, ambitious and challenging projects. Our goal is to foster excellence, both individual and communal, which to us means solving problems by breaking the rules, learning fast and autonomously and delivering with the best execution.
 
Before applying, you need to know that the company’s Culture is very important to us. Our employees evolve within an environment designed to be a centre for fulfillment. Daily life at Voodoo is characterised by numerous events throughout the year that allow you to feel fully integrated into the team and get involved in creative and innovative projects. Among them: onboarding programs, our annual global summit, other company-wide events, hackathons, game jams, wellness events and more. 
 
What will be your main challenges? 
We are looking for an industry expert to shape both the new games and the live games business of Voodoo Casual. Working closely with internal and external game studios,  you will oversee the whole portfolio of our casual games, supporting the products through their different development stages, from early development to live-game optimization.  
 
Relying on your deep knowledge of the market and Free-to-Play business model, you will help Voodoo to shape a new generation of casual games from the driving seat.



 
  • Help the game teams to define the long-term vision and the high-level design direction of the product.
  • Support the game teams to shape their product roadmap, channeling the hottest product & market trends into their planning & design process.
  • Work with the Analytics team to improve our products LTV and marketability, making sure that the games hit their ambitious milestones throughout the entire playtest cycle.
  • Research and explore innovative ways to combine IAP and Ads economy, working together with game and economy designers to constantly optimize our business model.
  • Prepare the games for Soft & Global launch, defining & executing on the live ops strategy (e.g. Content, Events, Shop).
  • Monitor the performance of our portfolio and support the central leadership team to forge the mid/long term strategy of the business unit.



What do we expect?
  • 3-5 experience as a Product Manager in a mobile gaming company. Experience with Ads monetization is a plus.
  • Deep understanding of the Free-to-Play business model: you have a solid knowledge of how the gaming business works, from conceptualization to scaling and live operations. You master game KPIs and know the product drivers that affect them.
  • Extensive knowledge of the gaming industry and of casual games: you are always up to date with new product trends, including new game mechanics, live ops and content strategies.
  • Entrepreneurial drive and agile problem solving: you will join a growing business unit of gaming professionals. You are comfortable exploring the unknown and you are always thinking & acting on new product opportunities.
  • Strong project management & communication skills: you can successfully lead multiple projects across our products portfolio, preparing top-notch documentation and sharing your knowledge with the other product leaders, senior management and other stakeholders across any level of the organization. 
  • Ambidextrous thinking and passion for our products: your contribution shines when you are put at the intersection of analytical and creative thinking. You are thrilled by the idea of developing the next generation of casual games with us.
What is your team about? 
You will be part of a great small team looking to create new experiences for our audience beyond the hypercasual market and this is where you come in!
 
What do we offer for this role?
Competitive compensation package ⧫ Free shares ⧫ Remote days ⧫ Lunch card ⧫ Wellness activities ⧫ Hackathon ⧫ Seminars ⧫ Global Summit 
 
We are offering all members of staff an unlimited vacation policy, allowing them to take as many paid days off as they wish as long as the work is done and objectives are achieved. 
 
What is our recruitment process?
Our recruitment process typically includes a call with our recruitment team, as well as interviews with your future manager and team members focusing on job fit. We will focus on your soft skills through values fit interviews that will determine if your values are compatible with ours. Lastly, a test / case study will feature at some point in your process. 
 
Does this sound like it was written with you in mind? Excellent! Put in your application and lets discuss the possibilities!

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
About the Role:

In this role, you will own the Living experience at Landing, from the moment a Member books their reservation to booking their next stay and everything in between. You will work closely with Design, Engineering, and cross-functional stakeholders to evolve Landing into a best-in-class consumer experience. This is an influential role that will have significant ownership and impact on key experience touchpoints for Landing’s core customer.

What You'll Do:
  • Drive product definition, strategy, and long term vision for which products and features we build, how we scale them and why.
  • Implement best in class product development and management practices.
  • Identify the biggest problems to solve. Drive new feature development from start to finish.
  • Participate in user research, usability studies, data-driven experiments to inform product direction
  • Define, monitor, and measure success metrics after launch. Consistently integrate behavior data and customer feedback into key product decisions.
  • Communicate product plans, benefits and results to all audiences - within teams, company, to users, etc.
  • Develop product roadmaps and build alignment across the organization (FP&A, Marketing, Operations, Customer Experience, Trust, etc.) and Leadership/Executive Team.
What You Need:
  • 3+ years of product management experience.
  • You have built and scaled consumer products, marketplaces, or ecosystems that people love.
  • You may not be a designer, but you have an eye for great design and user experiences.
  • You may not be a developer, but you understand system design and technical trade-offs.
  • You are able to understand and simplify complex ideas and processes.
  • You have demonstrated experience of effectively using data and performing business analysis to support product strategy and decisions.
  • You are collaborative and are able to communicate effectively with diverse stakeholders audiences across all levels of the organization.
  • BA/BS degree is preferred, ideally in technical, design, or social sciences related field.
About Us:

Landing is revolutionizing apartment living by providing our members the most streamlined end-to-end platform with access to tens of thousands of furnished and unfurnished apartments in over 80+ markets, and counting, that renters can book in just minutes. Our flexible leases allow members to realize more freedom and opportunities in life. Switching between apartments is simple, and does not require a security deposit, broker fee, or additional months' rent. You can manage every part of the Landing experience in a single, centralized app, which includes paying rent or scheduling regular cleanings with the touch of a finger.

Our dual headquarters reside in San Francisco, California, and Birmingham, Alabama, but our employees live and work all over the country. In addition to these two locations, Landing manages distribution centers across the U.S. that work to deliver and manage furnishings within our tailored homes. Our host network, comprising roughly 700 professionals, complement these areas by working directly with members to ensure their happiness and maintain comfort.

Join our rapidly expanding team to work on product, design, supply chain, operations, marketing, engineering, interior design, sales, legal, people, and finance to create more freedom and opportunities for renters across the U.S.

Our Leadership Principles:

At Landing, we use our Leadership Principles every day - whether we’re discussing new projects, deciding the best solutions for our members, or brainstorming a new product feature. We believe these shared values foster the best results.

Landing is a dynamic, fast moving, customer first organization whose core values are authenticity, ownership, a service-first mindset, and entrepreneurship. To be successful in creating the best experience for both our members and team members, we’re building a culture that thinks big, is hands-on, and solves problems at hyper warp speed. We are doers that do more with less and we’re constantly looking to raise the bar. Come enjoy the journey with us as we shake up the way people think about renting!

Benefits & Perks:

Landing aims to create a workplace that fosters both personal and professional growth. Our benefits include, but are not limited to:

  • Solid compensation package + stock options
  • Comprehensive benefits - medical, dental, and vision + pre-tax commuter & FSA
  • We’ve got you covered with our 401(k) plan
  • Feel relaxed with super generous paid-time-off
  • Grow with us - opportunities for upward mobility
  • Explore & travel comfortably - 7 free nights in a Landing home per year
  • Live with Landing - employee perks for temporary or indefinite stays

Landing provides equal opportunities for everyone that works for us and everyone that applies to join our team, without regard to sex or gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, any service, past, present, or future, in the uniformed services of the United States (military or veteran status), or any other consideration protected by federal, state, or local law.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Along with a talented team of product managers, you will partner closely with our leaders across research, tech, data science and business to achieve our company objectives.

  • Implementation: Together with the product design and engineering team, you will define the best solution for identified problems, being able to break it down into phases
  • Cooperation and Communication: You will drive user research, leading conversations with customers to fully understand their needs and collaborating with them in finding the best solutions. You will also teach and promote best practices across Clarity around product management and delivering an excellent client experience

Requirements

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:

  • Solid experience driving product management within ESG product companies or financial institutions (fintech a plus), with a proven track record of analyzing emerging market trends and competitive opportunities, developing and managing successful product roadmaps, and leading cross-functional teams to prioritize and develop new products
  • Bachelor’s Degree in business or engineering / computer science, ideally with professional experience in finance or software development
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
  • Analytical mindset with the ability to build strong data-driven arguments, prioritize with business strategy in mind, analyze risks and evangelize projects to build consensus within an organization
  • Fully autonomous with excellent leadership skills to guide multidisciplinary teams
  • Demonstrable execution in all parts of the product lifecycle: design, development, launch, and adoption
  • Complete fluency in English (minimum C1 level- proficient user)

Benefits

WHAT WE OFFER:

Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:

  • Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.

Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences.

 

We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:

  • Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.

jobs.description:
The Product Manager is responsible for the product planning and execution throughout the product life cycle, including: gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, defining the product vision, and working closely with engineering, sales, marketing, customer success and support to ensure revenue and customer satisfaction goals are met. The Product Manager’s job also includes ensuring that the product supports the company’s overall strategy and goals.

This position will report directly to the Vice President of Product and has the opportunity to work remotely or be based in our San Diego or Phoenix office. We’re looking for someone to join us immediately.

Requirements

Responsibilities

  • Act as owner for major features of the AutoVitals product suite, product lines, and project launches
  • Work closely with sales, marketing, customer success, support, and company leadership to elicit and capture product requirements based on market demand and company goals

  • A bias for action - “a good plan today is better than a perfect plan tomorrow”

  • Bonus: Experience working in the automotive technology industry

  • Bonus: Basic understanding of SQL, HTML and CSS

Benefits

As an employee, you would be eligible to participate in a comprehensive benefits package including a competitive salary, unlimited PTO, Medical, Dental, 401(k), life insurance and flexible spending plans.

If you're a smart, self-starter with solid experience in a high tech environment with a passion to make a difference, let us hear from you. Check us out at www.autovitals.com.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
We’re looking for a Product Manager to help us deliver on our bold mission. If you want to be at the forefront of changing the way healthcare is delivered… if you’ve geeked out on the possibilities of how the storm of new virtual care delivery models can transform the way patients receive care… if you’re looking for an opportunity to build world-class enterprise grade technology products… then this is the job for you!

What will you be doing?

You’ll be responsible for partnering with our product management, device operations, engineering, design, and other cross-functional teams to help shape and drive the roadmap for our patient experience. As the voice of the user champion, you’ll take lead on representing our patients in day-to-day decisions made at the engineering and delivery levels. Once launched, you’ll be equally passionate about enabling our client-facing teams to communicate these exciting new capabilities to customers.

Who are we looking for?

A strong, proactive individual with a bias for action and a passion for solving complex problems.

We value Product Managers who want to truly understand our customers, as well as sit with designers and engineers to dig into the details as owners of their specific product/feature.

Someone who has an innate ability to understand complex and technical concepts and to plan, prioritize and seamlessly integrate all moving parts in order to release high-quality products.

Is this job for you? It could be, if:

You can be hands-on. All of us contribute as individuals. Yes, as Product Management we craft product strategy and define roadmaps. We also roll up our sleeves and get in the trenches with our design, engineering, and customer teams.

You’re comfortable in a high growth environment. We’ve grown >40% in the last 6 months and have aggressive goals ahead. Our team is constantly adapting as we scale and tackle new challenges.

You thrive on growth. This is an opportunity to work in a fast-growing market on major business challenges. You’ll have the support of passionate, experienced co-workers, but our biggest challenges lie ahead of us. You’ll play a key role in finding and delivering answers.

If you’re a decisive, self-directed problem solver who thrives in a fast paced, collaborative environment and is up for the challenge of working with the best product team in the world, then we want to talk to you!

Key Duties & Responsibilities

You will own execution of key initiatives on our product roadmap for our patient experience. You will collaborate with customers and internal stakeholders, prioritize the product backlog, define product requirements, review and ensure alignment with technical teams, drive requirements through to production release, and ensure smooth post-release communications and product launches.

  • Participate in relevant agile and product development ceremonies
  • Be the expert and go-to person for your initiatives. Educate users and internal stakeholders on new features and enhancements, and create and/or contribute to relevant internal and external communications

  • Other duties as assigned

Requirements

The ideal candidate must be a collaborative individual with a strong sense of urgency, and a performance-based track record of accomplishments. A self-starter with a proclivity toward action as well as the flexibility to adapt to new priorities. This job requires a strong team player, someone comfortable partnering across functions and levels, including the senior leaders within the company.

  • 3+ years of proven product management experience, especially in enterprise B2B setting. You must have been in an actual Product Manager role responsible for defining and shipping actual products
  • Experience with hardware based commercial products, IoT devices, medical devices, connected or fully integrated devices, or for a device manufacturer highly desired
  • Proven track record of shipping products
  • Obsessive emphasis on user-driven product design and data-driven product refinement
  • Ability to hold your own in usability and user experience discussions with the Design team and technical discussions with Engineering
  • Ability to understand and discuss technical concepts, translate to user and customer implications, manage trade-offs, and facilitate decision-making
  • Ability to juggle multiple projects and tasks with varying degrees of priority in a fast-paced, high growth environment
  • Able to work autonomously with minimal daily supervision and demonstrated thoroughness, follow-up and attention to detail
  • Experience working in agile software development processes, including writing stories/epics, managing a backlog, and working with an agile development team
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Experience with digital care or technology products or applications in the healthcare space a plus
  • Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university required. Bachelor’s degree in mechanical or electrical engineering a plus

Benefits

jobs.title: Product Lead
jobs.description:
About Bedrock

Bedrock is operationalizing the largest Earth-exploration mission in human history. We’re doing that by developing robotics & software to explore, map, and classify the entirety of Earth's ocean floor. The oceans are a critical component of climate stabilization. Our hope is to provide critical subsea data and infrastructure to further understand and predict the fundamental forces that support harmonious human existence on this planet.

 

Background and Overview

Bedrock is looking for its first Product Lead role to own Mosaic, the world’s first cloud software platform for seafloor survey data.  The Product Lead will work directly alongside the CEO. 
A single file directory as in a traditional cloud storage platform (Dropbox, Google Drive, etc) is not the best way to manage enormous quantities (TBs or even PBs in some cases) of geospatial seafloor survey data. We’re building a single platform purpose-built for the data workflows required to use seafloor data (sonar & magnetometer), and then effectively manage, archive, and share that data with relevant parties. This is the first step to a global “library” and suite of value-add services that can be built on top of this data once it’s properly organized.
Ocean exploration is just an interpretation of seafloor data at scale, and that backbone will live in Mosaic.


Role

You’re an experienced digital product obsessive & strategic thinker who is comfortable defining a compelling product vision and designing a measurable strategy to achieve that vision. You have experience working on b2b software products in a startup environment, and you know how to take a product from concept to market. You take a human-centered approach to Product and understand how to balance user needs, business goals and technical implementation. You possess a strong sense and eye for design and great UI/UX.

 

Responsibilities
  • 7+ years of experience in SaaS or geospatial product org. 
  • Work closely with the CEO to create and own the Mosaic product strategy and roadmap.
  • Work closely with our Product Designer to create an industry-leading UI.
  • Analyze market demand and market fit, do competitive analysis, and identify strategic opportunities for product opportunities and growth.
  • Identify and proactively monitor and address product risks. 
  • Lead a cross-functional team of designers and software engineers to ensure Mosaic meets our audience’s needs.
  • Work closely with subject matter experts and beta users to understand and deliver on the unique technical requirements of subsea surveying data management. 
  • Manage an engineering backlog in collaboration with developers, designers, and product stakeholders.
  • Manage the release process and cross-functional dependencies.
  • This includes bridging gaps between different functions within the company as well as aligning marketing, sales, and customer support.
  • Evaluate ideas and ensure that feedback and requests are integrated into the product planning and development process.
  • You communicate and manage the status of ideas back to your customers, partners, and internal teammates who submitted them.
  • Initially working as the first line of customer success and ultimately building out that team. 

 

Explore the last true frontier left on Earth with us

We’re seeking ultra-determined people who aren’t afraid to pioneer new solutions and challenge conventional assumptions. Most of all, we're looking for high-quality, good human beings with low egos.

Bedrock is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Bedrock determines employment on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.

jobs.title: Product Engineer
jobs.description:
About Census 🔁

Census is how data teams at companies like Figma, Notion, Rippling, Clearbit, and Fivetran build better business operations.

With Census, analysts can turn their data warehouse into a single source of truth and publish their insights directly into the apps that marketing & sales teams use daily. With live data, these teams can build better campaigns, understand what users are doing, and ultimately drive more sustainable revenue.

We're a tight-knit team headquartered in San Francisco (but remote works too!) who love taking annoying problems most people avoid and building elegant solutions for them. We believe that data should be used for more than just making charts. This is why we built the first integration platform that works directly within cloud data warehouses.

Your Mission ⚡

As a Product Engineer at Census, you'll be working closely with the founders and the engineering team to improve every part of the user experience for an app used by some of the best data & operations folks in tech.

We have a small and senior team of engineers with years of industry experience from places like Amazon, Google and Dropbox as well tons of startup experience (we have 6 former YC founders on staff).

If you are just starting your career we are a great place for mentorship. If you are more seasoned, this is a great opportunity to join a no-nonsense efficient team.

If you are looking for a role where you can influence both the company culture and product experience, read on.

About the Role

You will make contributions to all parts of our product, which is a Vue app powered by a Rails API.

You will inform much of our early culture and be part of creating a truly special team.

You will be an active member of our sprint process - we do short sprint plans once every two weeks and 20 minute daily virtual standups.

You won't burn out – we are building a great product while creating a fun, family-friendly culture.

You will learn some of our lingo, like "do nothing", "done done", "ponies" and "ur-*"

Once you Apply 🗓

We try to make decisions quickly and have crafted a simple 3 step interview.

  1. A one-hour phone call with a member of the engineering team to learn more about you and run through a small technical problem together.
  2. A take-home coding problem. You can use any language you want. The problem takes a few hours and we give you a week to complete it. Time pressure is not the goal.
  3. A day-long hackathon with a few members of the team. We will bring you in-house (virtual during pandemic times or as otherwise appropriate) to build a small project with some other engineers and a PM. This gives us a chance to see what it's like working with you, and for you to get a feel for us.


Requirements
  • You can build things end-to-end (we don't consider an engineer's job done until the code is tested and in the hands of customers).
  • You have a Bachelor's degree in CS, Engineering, Math or equivalent experience.
  • You thrive in ambiguous environments where you get to work directly with customers and make decisions that have a huge impact on the business.

Our benefits 🏆
  • Competitive salary and equity
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance (full platinum coverage for dependents)
  • Laptop, monitor, and accessories
  • Flexible time off (20+ days/year recommended)
  • Parental leave

Census is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity and inclusion at our company. We welcome people of different nationalities, backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives.

What are you waiting for? Apply ⬇️

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
About you

We're looking to add an exceptional product manager to join the Found team and take over ownership for a core area of Found's product experience. Depending on your experience and interest, this will likely include our differentiated bookkeeping and tax features, customer acquisition and engagement strategy, and/or exploration and definition of net-new strategic bets. The ideal candidate is someone who is a true business owner and delights in finding new opportunities, defining them, and executing against them to drive the business forward. While previous fintech experience is a bonus, it is not a requirement for this role. 

  • 5+ years in a PM/ GM capacity, leading end-to-end user-facing product development. Direct previous experience in either a startup environment and/ or fintech is a bonus. 

  • You have a track record of building 0 -> 1 business opportunities that delight customers and deliver business value. You’re a self-starter and don’t need a highly-defined problem statement/ space to jump in and add value immediately.   

  • You are a business minded product owner. You delight as much in understanding what the business needs and owning core business KPIs as you do in building user-facing experiences. You’re a strategic thinker and enjoy having a seat at the table in setting company-level strategy. 

  • You’re unphased by uncertainty and thrive in ambiguous situations. You are as comfortable defining your own scope and mandate as you are executing on it.

  • Data-driven prioritization bias- you are finger-tippy with data and excited to build a roadmap prioritized by both quantitative and qualitative inputs. 

  • Excellent stakeholder management skills- you’re a great communicator and can synthesize multiple complex perspectives, requirements, and constraints across all your stakeholders to drive clarity on a clear go-forward path, no matter how complex the problem. 

  • You are an owner and a hustler, always pushing the boundaries of the user experience and advocating for the customer. You bring the team along with you by regularly sharing roadmaps, prioritization tradeoffs, and wins/ learnings. 

 

What you'll be working on

Day to day, you will:

  • Own a sizable chunk of the Found business day-to-day. Think of this role as half-PM/ half-GM. This may be a core piece of Found’s existing product experience (e.g. bookkeeping/ taxes) or our growth strategy/ new business line explorations, depending on your past experience and the top business needs over time. 

  • Build & maintain the roadmap for your business area, leveraging research and data insights to prioritize feature improvements and net-new feature buildout 

  • Pair closely with Engineering, Design, Data, and Legal/ Compliance to bring this roadmap to life, ensuring feature launches are bug-free, hit SLAs, and are fully compliant with regulations governing this space 

  • Drive OKRs, Quarterly goal-setting, and regular check-ins on progress-against-goals for your business area

jobs.title: Product Manager - Health Systems
jobs.description:
Memora Health is building an operating system for care delivery that implements intelligent workflows to streamline care delivery and revolutionizes the patient experience outside the care setting. We uniquely use artificial intelligence to digitize existing care delivery workflows, giving clinicians infrastructure that learns from every encounter they have. Memora supports a full suite of virtual care systems from automated patient intake and scheduling to remote monitoring and care pathways to billing and documentation. Memora is backed by Andreessen Horowitz, SV Angel, Kevin Durant, Martin Ventures, and several healthcare strategic groups.

Memora has established a significant presence within health systems and is beginning to rapidly scale operations in this market as well as expanding focus to the broader healthcare ecosystem. To do so, we are growing our team and are excited to bring on a Product Lead focused on our work in health systems who brings expertise in healthcare. This role is an opportunity to start on the ground floor of one of the fastest-growing healthcare companies and to help shape its product and success. In the process, you will have the opportunity to impact how the nation’s largest health systems and plans deliver care.

In this role, you will have a critical responsibility of leading our product as it is used with our health system partners. You will have a direct impact on care delivery and outcomes. You should not only be driven by the problem we are solving but also by the innovative approach and technology that we are applying to healthcare. We’re looking for someone with exceptional curiosity and enthusiasm for solving hard problems. 

 

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Identify and scope business needs and translate those needs into product requirements

  • Develop a detailed product strategy and roadmap based on customer feedback and market research

  • Have thought leadership around Memora’s product suite, its market, and its role in reshaping care delivery

  • Inform engineering priorities based on roadmap and customer feature requests

 

Qualifications (Required):

  • Deep understanding of clinical workflows across health systems

  • Track record of successful delivery of complex software products 

  • Strong analytics and data-driven approach to prioritization and roadmap development

  • Detailed understanding of software development lifecycle

  • 2+ years of experience working directly with engineers

Qualifications (Bonus):

  • Experience working as an engineer

  • Experience interfacing directly with health systems and owning relationships with customers

  • Domain knowledge specific to care delivery and clinical workflows

  • Significant network in health tech and health systems

 

What You Get:
