  • Work alongside a world-class team to help build and scale Memora

  • A dedicated external advisor who is an industry leader in product

  • Shape how leading health systems and plans think about their patient outreach and engagement strategies

  • Improve the way care is delivered for thousands of patients

  • Gain deep expertise about healthcare transformation and direct customer exposure with the country’s most innovative health systems and payers

  • Competitive salary and equity compensation with benefits including health, dental, and vision coverage, flexible work hours, paid maternity/paternity leave, bi-annual retreats, personal Macbook, and a 401(k) plan

jobs.title: Head of Product
jobs.description:
NEWNESS is the live-streaming platform built specifically for the beauty community. It’s a place where creators join in with a highly engaged community to talk about what they love--all in real time. 
 
We’re a fun, thoughtful, and passionate and diverse team. Some of our employees are tech veterans coming from Twitch, Facebook, Google and Glossier, lending our team a unique blend of live-streaming, tech, gaming, and beauty expertise. We are a remote-by-design early-stage startup and well funded by some of the top VCs and angel investors, including Sequoia Capital, Cowboy Ventures and Upside Partnership.
 
NEWNESS is seeking a Head of Product to shape the future of product across the organization. You’ll translate ideas into strategy and features, and follow product development from start to finish. As NEWNESS grows, you will scale a team of compassionate product managers. 
 
To succeed in this role, you should be a strategic and creative leader and problem-solver. You’ll work with teams across NEWNESS to ensure our roadmap is driving us toward the best possible version of our product. This role will have ownership of the product vision, strategy, principles, priorities, and evangelism as we scale and help define the future of live streaming and the creator economy. 
 
This role will report to the CEO. See link for our org chart.

  • Shaping and launching products that deliver the company’s product vision and strategy.
  • Owning core features end-to-end, including defining product specs, driving cross-functional execution, making complex decisions, and sharing insights and results company-wide.

  • Defining, understanding, and improving key growth funnels and metrics.

About you:

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:

jobs.title: Product Director, Growth
jobs.description:

We started with the reinvention of insurance and a bold mission to create a data science powered platform that actually helps people become better drivers. We aspire to be the best in the business at identifying low-risk drivers by harnessing the power of data with an innovative technology stack.    
 
It’s a big goal, and that’s where you come in. We're growing a world class team of data science, engineering, design, product, marketing and mobile technologists because we know that the key to success isn’t just about nailing the technology—it’s hiring the talented people who will help us make a quantifiable impact.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
About Us

At any given time, 15 million Americans are experiencing a crisis that requires urgent help from our legal system or government. The right assistance can transform their lives. But today, most never get it. Atticus is a startup on a mission to change that.

We're reinventing a broken space: the $100 billion market for legal services for individuals. Through proprietary technology, a top-tier team, and a network of the nation’s top local law firms, we've taken a rare and exclusive commodity — access to expert legal advice and referrals — and made it free and available to everyone. To clients, we're a source of trusted guidance and an easy way to find and hire a great lawyer. To lawyers, we're a source of vetted clients and a way to build a practice they love while doing good. Today, most of our work involves helping disabled Americans qualify for government benefits. We also help victims of accidents, misconduct, and violence recover by getting compensation from insurance.

We've raised $28 million from top VC firms like Forerunner (Jet, Glossier, Warby Parker) and True Ventures (Peloton, Fitbit, Ring) and helped thousands of people in need (see our 1,200+ five-star reviews). We're small but moving fast — our team of 16 will grow to 30 this year — and we're seeking great people to help in our mission.

 

The Role

To provide a great experience for a client, we have to do a lot quickly: Understand their situation, identify their needs, give advice, match them with the right lawyer, connect them to that lawyer, convince both parties to work together, and formalize the arrangement — all while doing our best to make a complex and scary system feel simple, accessible, and human. We’ve managed to do all of this in a way that users love, but we’ve done it by leaving some parts of the process quite manual... which means we can only scale so far.

Your job is to change that: to lead the effort to transform our product into a platform that can serve millions of people. You'll craft a strategic plan and roadmap, then coordinate our teams — design, engineering, and client service — to implement it. As our first product manager, you’ll own key metrics and outcomes, and get to think holistically about how to achieve them. The role mixes strategy, data analysis, product design, and a lot of people management. It's a hard job, with huge potential for impact and promotion.

Responsibilities
  • Get to know our users — both clients and lawyers — and understand their needs.
  • Craft a product vision for our next phase of growth. Go deep on strategy: become an expert in our business model, current offering, and key milestones to inform your work.
  • Develop a comprehensive product roadmap, and build alignment for it from the full team.
  • Implement a product development process and manage it; teach best practices to others.
  • Work with engineering and design to build and ship new products and features. Play the role of conductor, coordinating and empowering others.
  • Own key targets and metrics. Collect and analyze data, and use it to drive decision-making at a company level. Propose hypotheses, run experiments to test them, and iterate quickly
Qualifications

Critical:

  • 4+ years of product management experience, building and shipping products at scale
  • Demonstrated success setting product vision and strategy, and the ability to speak thoughtfully about key decisions and tradeoffs you made
  • Knowledge of best practices (from past work in a high-performing organization) and the ability to instill a great product culture as we grow
  • Great communication and people skills — shown by great reviews from engineers and designers you’ve worked with
  • Mastery of analytics platforms and ability to do you own data gathering and analysis
  • A track record of running lean experiments and using data to drive decisions
  • Ability to empathize with a diverse user base, including disabled and older users
  • A demonstrated commitment to doing good and helping people

Bonus / Nice-to-Have:

  • Experience with complex consumer services and/or two-sided marketplaces
  • Experience scaling a product organization from its early days
  • A technical background in engineering, data science, or operations
  • Past work at a fast-growing startup

We have a strong commitment to building a diverse team. If you’re from a background that’s underrepresented in law and tech, we’d particularly love to meet you.

 
Benefits

This is a rare opportunity to join a startup that has strong traction (substantial funding, well-respected backers, tremendous growth, and many happy customers) but is still small enough that you can have a huge impact and play a role in shaping our culture.

We’re a certified B Corporation tackling a critical social problem. Our mission to help people in need drives everything we do, and your work here will touch many lives.

We offer competitive pay — including equity — and generous benefits:

  • Medical and dental insurance with 100% of employee premiums covered
  • 15 vacation days & 16 paid holidays each year
  • Free membership to OneMedical
  • $1,000/year reimbursable stipend for education and training outside of work 
  • $600/year reimbursable stipend for exercise and fitness
  • Up to $1,200/year student loan repayment assistance
  • 401(k) and optional HSA
  • Free snacks, drinks, weekly lunches, and regular team dinners/events/retreats
  • Humble, thoughtful, smart, fun colleagues
 
Location & COVID-19

Today, half our team are in Los Angeles, a quarter (all from the client care department) are in Phoenix, and a quarter are elsewhere and fully remote. There are two options for this job:

  1. Live in Los Angeles, working a few days a week (or more) out of our beautiful office in the Arts District.
  2. Live wherever, work remotely, and travel to LA (on the company dime, of course) as needed to be with your colleagues — probably quarterly (or more if you want).

In short: You can do this job remotely, and we’re committed to empowering everyone with flexibility. But we care a lot about building a great culture and we think some interactions need to happen in person, so we put a lot of thought into retreats, offsites, and other ways to gather. 

As for COVID-19: When the pandemic started, we immediately shifted to fully remote to protect our team and shuttered our office. Today, everyone on the team is vaccinated, and many come in often (though we don’t require anyone to). Going forward, you can expect that vaccinations will continue to be required for all employees and that if the delta variant worsens or a new variant emerges that’s life-threatening for vaccinated people, we’ll return to fully remote temporarily.

 

(Note: We sometimes get asked about medical exemptions for COVID vaccination. Of course we’d make an exception for anyone who is medically unable to get the vaccine. But current CDC guidance is that almost no one falls into this category: the only groups advised not to be vaccinated are folks with a severe allergy to both polyethylene glycol and polysorbate, or who have a documented history of anaphylactic shock from past vaccines. We’re willing to consider good-faith reasons, but please know that for us this is a workplace safety issue and our bar is high when it comes to protecting our team.)

 

How to Apply

Use the short form below. Questions? Email hiring@atticus.com.

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
jobs.description:
Mapistry’s SaaS platform provides industrial companies with the compliance data tracking and analytics they need to make better environmental, health, and safety (EHS) decisions.

jobs.title: Product Manager, Growth
jobs.description:
Grammarly offers a remote-first hybrid working model. Team members can work primarily remotely. Starting in 2022, teams will meet in person a few weeks every quarter in one of Grammarly's hubs, currently in San Francisco, Vancouver, New York, and Kyiv. To ensure that teams are able to overlap in their working hours and to meet face-to-face when needed, all team members need to live within three time zones of a hub. Read more about our remote-first hybrid model.

Grammarly team members who will be collaborating at our San Francisco hub must be based in the United States.

The opportunity 

Grammarly empowers people to thrive and connect, whenever and wherever they communicate. Every day, 30 million people and 30,000 teams around the world use our AI-powered writing assistant. All of this begins with our team collaborating in a values-driven and learning-oriented environment. 

To achieve our ambitious goals, we’re looking for a Product Manager to join our Growth team. Grammarly’s vision is to improve lives by improving communication—and core to this vision is meeting the communication needs of people worldwide. The Product Manager, Growth will play a crucial role in acquiring, retaining, and monetizing users through customer-centric features and user flows. This role will drive key Growth product initiatives for user acquisition, building the mechanisms that allow us to acquire various types of users, learn about them, route them into the right experiences, and maintain them long-term. 

Your impact

As Product Manager on the Growth team, you will incubate, test, and scale new product experiences and capabilities that drive company-level metrics specifically related to new user acquisition. You will gain a deep understanding of our various customer segments and their jobs to be done, and design and build innovative features and flows comprising a product-led acquisition engine.  

To achieve this goal, you’ll need to build new experiences and capabilities from scratch, such as viral hooks into places where people write together collaboratively (e.g., Google Docs), and will also need to consider the many contexts where people use Grammarly.  

In this role, you will:

  • Own the strategy, roadmap, and execution of key Growth product initiatives related to user acquisition.
  • Partner closely with Marketing and User Research teams to understand various user segments and growth opportunities. 
  • Develop a deep understanding of the customer journey, continually gaining learnings and making decisions through customer insights, quantitative analysis, and A/B testing. 
  • Work with a team of engineers, designers, and data scientists to build delightful, outstanding Growth features and flow.
  • Rapidly execute and iterate with an emphasis on user delight, impact, and learning while regularly making bold bets and calculated tradeoffs.
We’re looking for someone who
  • Embodies our EAGER values—is ethical, adaptable, gritty, empathetic, and remarkable.
  • Can be highly strategic and hands-on, with the ability to see and plan for the mid- and long-term, connecting priorities to the company and product vision and translating that into an actionable roadmap.
  • Has an owner’s mindset—and doesn’t shy away from the hard stuff.
  • Demonstrates the ability to drive projects in partnership with cross-functional teams, with an emphasis on prioritization, communication, and a bias toward action and results.
  • Possesses strong analytical skills, competence in SQL, and experience with tools for doing data analysis.
  • Is an exceptional problem solver and thrives in ambiguity—with an attitude that embraces the twists and turns of any zero-to-one product initiative.
Support for you, professionally and personally
  • Professional growth: We hire people we trust, and we give team members autonomy to do their best work. We also support professional development with training, coaching, and regular feedback.
  • A connected team: Grammarly builds a product that helps people connect, and we apply this mindset to our own team. We have a highly collaborative culture supported by our EAGER values. We also take time to celebrate our colleagues and accomplishments with global, local, and team-specific events and programs.
  • Comprehensive benefits: Grammarly offers all team members competitive pay along with a benefits package that includes superior health care. We also offer support to set up a home office, ample and defined time off, gym and recreation stipends, admission discounts, and more.
We encourage you to apply

At Grammarly, we value our differences, and we encourage all—especially those whose identities are traditionally underrepresented in tech organizations—to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Grammarly will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Grammarly is an equal opportunity employer and participant in the U.S. Federal E-Verify program.

Celtra helps digital publishers and platforms not only monetize their digital real estate with beautiful ad formats, but also work more effectively using our design, delivery, and performance measurement workflow solutions. jobs.title: Product Manager, Database (Toolkit)
jobs.description:
Timescale is looking for an experienced Product Manager to help us build our category-defining relational database for time-series data, and make time-series data radically easier to analyze.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a new product initiative at a fast-scaling company, where you can have significant impact to shape the product. The mission of our new database toolkit is to ease all things analytics when using TimescaleDB (and SQL for time-series data), with a particular focus on developer ergonomics and performance. You will work closely with engineering to help define the database product, and should bring experience in the full product lifecycle from discovery to delivery. You should be able to closely understand our user’s needs, from the highly technical (the design of SQL and API interfaces, query performance and optimizations, etc.) to strong customer empathy for the new user experience and developer productivity.  This initiative, like many other things at Timescale, takes an open, community-first ethos, so you should be comfortable designing and working in the open with our broader developer community (e.g., on github).

We need you to help us think tactically and move strategically so we can meet our ambitious goals and build the next great product for developers. If you have experience in product management and want a role where you can have a direct and immediate impact on a fast-growing startup serving developers worldwide, then this is the role for you.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with our product/engineering team to craft product strategy, define product roadmap, prioritize bugs, and ship new and enhanced capabilities for our database 
  • Own delivery of new product features end-to-end, including for both community downloads and our fully managed cloud platform
  • Define new product ideas and product improvements based on first principles, user feedback and interviews, and other stakeholder input
  • Work with the marketing team for messaging, positioning, and launch activities, and serve to help engage the developer community in feedback and adoption
  • Serve as the connective tissue between engineering, design, marketing, customer care, and other stakeholders, proactively communicating product questions and decisions

Requirements

  • 3+ years of proven track record in technical product management, ideally working on developer-centric products
  • Strong understanding of SQL, APIs, and databases
  • Technical aptitude and attention to detail
  • Superlative spoken and written communication skills
  • Can focus on output, own responsibilities, and get things done
  • Comfortable engaging and working in the open with developer communities
  • Experience exerting influence without direct authority
  • Passionate about making developers successful, empathy for users and customers
  • Computer Science or technical degree much preferred, or prior experience as a developer

About Timescale

At Timescale, we are dedicated to serving developers worldwide, enabling them to build exceptional data-driven products that measure everything that matters: software applications, industrial equipment, financial markets, blockchain activity, consumer behavior, machine learning models, climate change, and more. Analyzing this data across the time dimension (“time-series data”) enables developers to understand what is happening right now, how that is changing, and why that is changing. Timescale develops TimescaleDB, the category-defining open-source relational database for time-series data, and offers fully-managed TimescaleDB and related database services. Timescale is a remote-first company with a global workforce and is backed by Benchmark Capital, New Enterprise Associates, Redpoint Ventures, Icon Ventures, Two Sigma Ventures, and other leading investors.

jobs.title: Director of Product
jobs.description:

You’ll be the perfect mix of detailed product thinker combined with a love for being client facing. You’re a natural leader with a global mindset, but don’t mind working autonomously either.

Requirements

Our Product

  • We make it easy for people to sell things they don’t own. We help businesses supercharge their commerce offering by connecting third party sellers.
  • Our platform is modular with tools for marketplace operators, sellers and shoppers. Clients either choose our full-stack offering, build a headless commerce experience or connect into another digital commerce platform.
  • We are API-driven and we know that our success depends on playing nicely as part of a broader ecosystem.

  • Communicating requirements to teams in the US and in Australia to deliver on our promises to customers.
  • Collaborating with product managers in Australia to ensure that what we’re building fits into our strategic plan.
  • Planning releases, coordinating timeline and tasks with product managers and delivery management

  • At least 5+ years of experience in a product management function. Preferably with a background in commerce.
  • Experience working in a small team where your role is defined by the gaps between roles as by the defined role definition.
  • Good communication and collaboration skills, with a knack for translating business requirements into problems that engineers will understand.

Benefits

  • Be Bold - You’re not afraid to fail fast, you ask for forgiveness not permission, you solve problems other can’t and you’re always innovating
  • Be their Best - You’re authentic, balanced, curious and most of all, a good human
  • Make it happen - You’re accountable to focus on quality, you measure twice and cut once and most importantly you get sh!t done whilst executing with pace
  • Grow together - We have your back because together we win. We are obsessed with our members/customers
  • Make it easy - Our products are intuitive, we’re easy to work with and we remove blockers

You’ll love working for us because:

  • You’ll be provided with a top-of-the-line laptop of your choice (MacBook, Dell XPS, etc) and any software that you need to do your job
  • Plenty of autonomy and opportunity to grow, regular check ins with your manager
  • Access to our learning platform with over 90,000 courses & videos to choose from

jobs.title: Engineering and Product Director
jobs.description:
Engineering and Product Director, CommunityConnect Labs

Location: Anywhere in the US

Who We Are

CommunityConnect Labs is a tech-first social impact organization.  We are a leading provider of technology solutions that help local and state governments conduct outreach and engagement to their most underserved residents.  We are a fast-growing organization positioned to dramatically increase our impact over the coming years.

Last year, we served over 10 million people, to activate participation in the Census, vote in Elections, and get COVID relief. We did this by providing mobile web, text SMS, and mobile app outreach solutions, as well as content and strategy advisory services.

Our Census outreach project alone yielded a 4500x ROI, providing an estimated $12.2 billion in federal funding for essential services.

Our success has been recognized across the country: We are winners of the Battery Powered Award, Twilio Social Impact Fund, Amazon Imagine grant, and awards from New Media Ventures and Full Circle Fund.  Our work has been evaluated by governments and published in statistical journals.

Our tech stack is up to date: AWS (EBS, ECS, Elastic Beanstalk, CloudWatch ElastiCache, ElasticSearch, RDS, EC2), microservices, CICD, PagerDuty, GitHub, Jenkins, ReactJS, Go, and more.

To learn more about our work and impact visit https://www.communityconnectla... Opportunity

As our organization grows we are seeking an Engineering and Product Lead who will be responsible for the organization's Engineering and Product planning, processes, and execution. This role will be a senior leader in the organization, providing leadership for a team of 5 including software engineers and product managers.

You will get to build new Customer Experience Solutions that enable government agencies - providing public health outreach, job training services, and other essential human services - to communicate with residents through multi-channel communications, in multiple languages, with a combination of AI and human interactions.

You will have the opportunity to use your tech skills to help some of our most vulnerable residents. Specifically, you will:

  • Make a concrete, tangible difference in the lives of millions of people all across the country.
  • Influence decision-makers at high levels of government and help them embrace technology as a resource for delivery of critical services. You will enable federal, state, local governments, and nonprofits provide better services for low-income communities at scale.
  • Solve some of the country's hardest problems
  • Join a supportive, and adventurous environment with smart, engaged colleagues who come to work every day with the organization's mission in mind.
  • Have flexibility on work hours/schedule and work location.

 

Responsibilities

The Engineering and Product Director will be responsible for product planning and execution across multiple products. Day to day work will include: gathering and prioritizing product and customer requirements, writing technical specs, analyzing user data, creating mock-ups, creating demos, , and working closely with engineering, implementation and business development to ensure social impact and financial goals are met. The Product Lead's job also includes ensuring that the product supports the organization's overall strategy and goals.

 

The Engineering and Product Director is expected to:

  • Be a player and a coach in Engineering and Product
  • Develop and run beta and pilot programs with early-stage products and manage new feature development 
  • Collect customer requirements, create mock-ups and demos,  and write specs for engineering with prioritized features and corresponding justification
  • Work with Engineering and QA teams to identify and resolve code issues
  • Design and develop full-stack application business logic using ReactJS, Go, Python/Django, NodeJS, SQL, HTML/CSS, related technologies
  • Interface with Implementation Team to determine key requirements
  • Work with external third parties to assess partnership opportunities and communicate the product context and strategy.

 

Qualifications 

  • 10+ years of Engineering experience ideally in communications software such as Contact Center, or omnichannel digital communications - email, chatbots, webchat, SMS  
  • Demonstrated success defining and launching early stage products
  • Has led high quality product development using an agile methodology - iteratively improving products through delivery cycles.
  • Proven ability to interpret and leverage user research, user testing, and data analytics to make and validate product decisions.
  • Strong Engineering and Product judgement - knowing when to prototype and when to code, when to experiment and when to change direction.
  • Demonstrated ability to thrive on a growing, remote, globally-distributed team 
  • Previous staff management experience and strong stories of proactive leadership and continuous team development
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Excellent teamwork skills, proven ability to influence cross-functional teams and ability to thrive on a growing, remote team

 

And Bonus Points For

  • Experience in a mission-driven organization
  • Experience with HIPAA compliance and security audits
  • A strong nose for cloud-based, microservices architectures
  • Familiarity with webchat, SMS, and Twilio's APIs and platform
  • A substantial portion of our tech stack uses the Go/Python-based third party platform RapidPro, so experience with that is a welcome bonus, but not strictly required

Our Team's Culture and Benefits

We know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits including health benefits and professional development opportunities.

We are impatient changemakers. The work is challenging and fast-paced. The hours are long and we expect the highest quality of work from ourselves.

‍We offer you the flexibility to make daily choices that can help you to be healthy, centered, and productive.  We are a mission-driven company where you can do your best, most important work for society. We continuously look for new ways to maintain a culture where our people's talents are nourished and can shine.

A diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is an integral part of our culture. We actively welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We are an equal opportunity employer and a great place to work. Join us to achieve our mission.

To perform in this role you will need a strong understanding of the DeFi industry (exchanges, stablecoin, lending platforms, saving products, stock exchanges) and will preferably have worked in blockchain. You will have acquired a solid financial background and you will be able to conduct with confidence and lead IOG’s efforts to make Cardano ever more accessible and relevant.

Your mission

As Head of DeFi products at IOG you will oversee a product line from inception through to implementation and release, and manage a team of skilled product managers to carry out the vision. You will develop a strategy for IOG in DeFi and rationalize and elaborate a DeFi offering by capitalizing on IOG’s products, such as Marlowe, and on emerging opportunities.

Duties will include:

  • Managing the product lifecycle from strategic planning to tactical activities
  • Overseeing all product roadmaps for company products based on market research and collaborating with internal and external groups and stakeholders
  • Executing roadmap strategies and bringing valuable, highly differentiated and elegantly designed capabilities to market
  • Working with customers and partners to ensure that their needs are addressed in the roadmap and that they are kept apprised of releases and updates
  • Collaborating with marketing and communications teams to explain how changes will affect users and helping to develop communications material for the wider market
  • Developing a detailed understanding of trends in the product landscape to drive product excellence
  • Managing the collection, description, analysis and prioritization of requests for product changes from customers, prospects, partners, sales, and market-driven forces
  • Working with business development on evaluating proposals for the roadmap, and with project managers on delivery, planning and scheduling
  • Helping product managers in defining priorities for product development
  • Working with engineers and designers to deliver a captivating, reliable, and easy-to-use experience with excellent UI
  • Working with business analysts on defining and detailing requirements from a functional and non-functional perspective
  • Providing support to the sales team on product selection, presentations and pricing strategy
  • Providing technical guidance in evaluating applications systems or requests for proposals.

Requirements

Your expertise

  • Experience working in DeFi (exchanges, stablecoin, oracles, etc)
  • Experience working in finance (stock exchanges, derivatives, lending platforms, saving products, etc)
  • A background in distributed computing and experience with blockchain technologies
  • MBA preferred
  • Product management certification is a plus (CPM, AIPMM)
  • Experience as a product manager or in a product leadership role
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with a passion for big data
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Experience in decentralized protocols/blockchain
  • At least 10 years’ experience of product management in software companies
  • Experience of launching platform-based products
  • Experience of launching global services
  • Experience with distributed systems, blockchain, and crypto
  • Experience working with software development and marketing teams, preferably in fintech
  • Experience implementing processes to define metrics and measure the success of products that are launched
  • Experience leading highly technical engineering, design and business teams
  • Proven ability in developing productive relationships with a variety of levels and roles and managing user expectations
  • Experience leading cross-functional teams in close partnership with engineering and design. Own deliverables with clear priorities. Keeping releases focused, on track and at a high quality
  • Demonstrated competency with requirements elicitation, analysis, specification.

Benefits

Location

IOG is a fully distributed organization and therefore this is a remote position. Due to team distribution we are ideally searching for someone in a European to AST timezone.

All Colleagues

US Employees

jobs.title: Senior Product Manager
jobs.description:
Job Title: Senior Product Manager

Department: Product

Reports to: VP of Product

 

Come join LeagueApps and the team that is at the center of the fast-growing youth sports market, a $70B opportunity in the U.S. alone.

About LeagueApps:

 

Born and bred in New York City, LeagueApps is the operating system and community for youth and local sports leaders—providing them with the technology and professional network they need to succeed. A fast-growing, venture-backed company, we power thousands of clubs, tournaments, leagues, camps, and facilities with a platform that reaches more than 10 million participants nationwide. 

 

We’re committed to our mission—creating amazing sports experiences for all. Through our FundPlay program, we donate a percentage of every dollar spent on our platform back to the communities and families that need it. Our goal is to impact 500,000 underserved athletes by 2022. Beyond FundPlay, we advocate for accessibility and equity through PLAYS, a movement we helped launch and lead to mobilize the industry  in spring 2020, and by creating awareness around the systemic issues that keep kids on the bench. (You can listen to our President discussing this during a recent event with Axios as part of their Hard Truths Deep Dives content series.)  

 

Last year, we were ranked on Deloitte’s Fast 500, were recognized by Hashtag Sports for our industry leadership in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, and named a “Best Employer in Sport” by Front Office Sports and BuiltIn NYC. We’re looking for team members who want to be part of building the greatest local sports company in the world.

Role Mission: Create the market-leading experience and a product uniquely suited for the youth sports industry’s fastest growing and most influential organizations needs

Responsibilities:

1) Define the strategy and plan roadmaps and releases for your product

  • Develop the strategy for your product area: Member & Admin management, including:
    • Global navigation & configuration
    • Member accounts & profiles
    • Account identity
    • Roles & permissions
  • Conduct ongoing internal and external discovery to understand context, business, and identify problems to solve.
  • Own the product backlog for your squad. 
  • Work closely with design and engineering to ideate on solutions.
  • Prioritize based on qualitative and quantitative data.
  • Propose and own your roadmap.
  • Run experiments and  test hypotheses. 
  • Work with internal stakeholders to develop release plans and go-to-market activities.
  • Know your market: keep up with industry trends and competition to feed into prioritization criteria.

2) Manage the implementation with your squad

  • Generate user stories, write acceptance criteria (in JIRA) and groom sprint tickets in very close collaboration with engineers and design for your squad. 
  • Manage the day to day Agile ceremonies with your Squad.
  • Organize feedback sessions with internal stakeholders and clients. 
  • Collaborate with QA to ensure a quality release. 
  • Review and accept tickets for release.
  • Organize canary and/or UAT sessions.
  • Identify and propose areas for continuous improvement.

3) Align and communicate cross-functionally

  • Communicate product plans and roadmaps internally. 
  • Develop release plans and communications with product marketing for larger features.  
  • Communicate ongoing releases to the company for your squad.
  • Represent your product area in client meetings and external events. 

3) Measure success

  • Collaborate with data analysts to identify quantitative goals for feature epics.
  • Track and analyze product data to determine impact of product releases on epic goals and OKRs.
  • Communicate success and impact on OKRS and users.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of related experience, such as product management, product or business analyst, or engineering role.
  • Bachelor in Computer Science, Business, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Experience with B2B products.
  • Strong product and Agile methodologies for entire product lifecycle with ability to coach others.
  • Customer oriented - thinks about delivering value to customers.
  • Curious and inquisitive mindset to identify problems to solve vs. stated problems.
  • Strong analytical skills, excellent at synthesizing information, and detailed oriented when needed.
  • Organized and structured thinker.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills for internal and client interactions.
  • Natural collaborator and enjoy working in teams to identify and implement great solutions.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced environment with the ability to work autonomously, while taking guidance from your manager.

Working at LeagueApps:

  • Equity Grants
  • Medical, Dental, Vision, and Paid Parental Leave coverage
  • We'll pay for your sports leagues (and your kids sports leagues)!
  • Cell Phone and Gym Subsidies and CitiBike discounts
  • Culture and work environment that emphasizes teamwork, passion, learning, and fun.  Follow us on Instagram to see for yourself.
  • Social impact opportunities through our FundPlay initiative that includes events, volunteering, and grant-making

LeagueApps is an equal-opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

We are committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and equitable organization, and to helping youth sports organizers across the country do the same.

jobs.title: Product Manager, Platform Applications
jobs.description:
About Extend:
 
Extend is modernizing the $100 billion-per-year extended warranty and protection plan industry using cutting-edge technology, and top-notch customer service. After a $260M Series C financing round, we are ready to continue to scale our organization and grow beyond our $1.6B valuation. 
 
Our API-first solution allows any merchant to offer extended warranties and protection plans, both online and offline, while also providing a merchant's end customers with a vastly improved and modern support experience that eliminates many of the issues customers face today with legacy underwriters.
 
We are a venture-backed startup based in downtown San Francisco (and since COVID began, fully remote) that is led by founders who have previously had multiple successful exits. Extend is simplifying the technology stack for the extended warranty industry.
 
About the Role:
 
Extend is looking for a Product Manager to work within our Platform Applications Team.  The Platform Applications product management team is responsible for building and managing Extend’s integrations with eCommerce websites, SDKs used in webstore deployment, and other front-end portals and tools.  In this role, you will have a big impact on Extend by creating software that enables warranty program adoption and revenue growth for our merchant partners.

What We're Looking For:
  • Bachelor’s degree in a relevant technical field.
  • 3+ years of product management experience in a software company.
  • Experience running software development sprints and organizing work in JIRA.
  • Strong leadership skills with a team-oriented and collaborative approach to work.
  • Great interpersonal and communication skills that shine when you’re talking with a customer or engaging a cross-functional audience.

jobs.title: Head of Product
jobs.description:
Why?

With so many companies transitioning to remote work, what we offer is more relevant than ever, and we are growing fast. Be part of amazing growth with an amazing Product team.

What?

We are looking for amazing Heads of Product to lead the company in its growth and mission. Our Heads of Product lead large portions of the business, driving tangible business objectives. They don’t just lead engineers and design, they create cross-functional teams including all aspects of the business to tackle the most difficult problems for our customers. The Heads of Product will have PMs reporting to them, and will be responsible for product delivery across those sections of the business.

Product at Omnipresent creates empowered product teams. For more information on this management philosophy, see https://svpg.com/empowered-product-teams/

We are a non-hierarchical company; you are going to get exposure to all aspects of our business immediately. You’ll get as much accountability as you can handle and have a huge influence on scaling the company.

Omnipresent makes remote teams work, and in turn we are globally remote. Your design team can and should be located throughout the globe, which is an exciting opportunity to build a diverse powerful team making a global impact.

Who?

You are a strong leader and builder, have incredible drive and are naturally curious. You are especially good at detangling complex business goals and creating a team to achieve those goals. You take initiative, communicate well to drive your teams, drive projects independently, and report up clearly to the company executives.

This role reports to the VP of Product.

About Omnipresent

Remote work is one of the great equalisers of our time, allowing people to secure employment opportunities from companies around the world, no matter where they were born or where they live.

Yet, at a time when remote work is exploding, most companies are finding it too complex, costly and time consuming to employ workers internationally. At Omnipresent, we’re cutting this complexity and providing our clients, and their remote workers, with a simplified, cost effective and legally compliant employment experience. With a network of legal entities across the world, coupled with an automation-focused tech platform, we’re building the premier global employment-as-a-service offering on the market.

Your responsibilities
  • Ownership of KPIs and product-driven vision for a key portion of Omnipresent’s business.
  • Be a Product leader in the company, working with other senior leaders to help set company goals and strategy. Mentor and coach not only your PMs, but across the function. Lead the creation of an empowered, involved, informed and inspired culture for your teams and, leveraging the PM team you help to shape, drive clarity throughout the company.
  • Lead and mentor teams to discover user needs, understand and define the product’s market positioning, define and refine team KPIs and objectives, understand tech tradeoffs, and create a roadmap that balances users, tech and business needs.
  • Lead your empowered product development team(s) to execute against that roadmap to deliver substantial timely value against those KPIs and objectives.
  • Build a strong understanding of the users and market for your product, from competitive analysis to user segmentation, craft a vision for execution, and drive this clarity through the business.
  • Be a strong advocate for user needs across all functional areas, and help maintain the proper intersection of user needs with implementation and business needs.
  • Manage the product objectives, key results and roadmap for your assigned business area; ensure these dovetail into the company commercial strategy
  • Work directly with execs, stakeholders across the business, directly manage the output of sub-teams, and of course work very closely with development teams.
  • Use data to shape your narratives and prioritisation, and to drive understanding through the business using clear communication techniques.
What you need to be great at
  • Leadership of Product Managers, driving a Product philosophy through the company, and being a proactive part of the Product leadership team.
  • Ability to create, sell and curate a product strategy for your part of the company.
  • Tolerance and even an enthusiasm for ambiguity, and a bias to action that creates a data-driven path forward despite an unclear path.
  • Personal stature, gravitas, a relationship builder, and excellent communication skills.
  • Develop excellent working relationships with leaders throughout the company.
  • Excellent critical judgment; able to make good decisions, be trusted, respected and dependable, be proactive and responsive, ask the right questions, raise flags at the right time, able to prioritise and plan workloads for the team.
  • Analytical thinking capability; logical, systematic, strategic and pragmatic, at a company-wide scope.
  • Deftly wielding multiple agile practises through software lifecycles. Educating the wider business teams on the development process.
Who we are looking for; track record must haves
  • 8+ years of product management experience and 3+ years of managing other PMs.
  • Experience driving the business by shipping complex business-driven products, ideally in a SaaS environment.
  • Demonstrated success in owning strategy through delivery, balancing user needs, clear business goals and complex technical implementations to create a functional and beautiful product.
  • Experienced in fostering the customer experience, end-to-end journey, UX and UI.
  • Delivered complex projects with agile development teams, with a firm personal belief in ship, learn & iterate.
Experience that would be nice to have (but we’ll trade off if everything else fits)
  • Delivered a mass-market B2B product or service via a bespoke tech (digital) platform.
  • Experience with People Operations software and businesses.
  • Experience with Product Management in a startup or scale up.

Benefits

What’s in it for you (apart from the most fun and challenging ride of your life!)

  • Huge development opportunities - you will be joining an early Product team in a young and rapidly growing company
  • Shared ownership - Being a part of our journey means you will own a piece of Omnipresent
  • Annual vacation entitlement: 33 days including local holidays
  • Equipment and infrastructure: We give you a budget for all the equipment you need to work effectively wherever you are
  • Company retreats: We are planning biannual company-wide retreats post COVID, and well as socials and other team building activities
  • Flexible working - Work from anywhere in the world - We don’t care where or when you work as long as the job gets done. We are genuinely as flexible as the work allows

We believe remote working is a great equaliser and we practice what we preach. Inclusivity is fundamental to our mission and we are committed to conscious inclusion. We believe in the potential of everyone; regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic origin, different physical ability, family structure, socio-economics, age, nationality or citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, or gender identity.
